assessmentNote: This proposal lacks focus on the goals of the Distributed Decision Making challenge. It proposes a platform using smart contracts which allows programmers to share ideas and learn from eachother. While important, this doesn't attract new community members to engage in decision making or increase confidence in the decisions being made.
This proposal appears to be for an application / tool which supports the Cardano ecosytem, but does not get to the heart of the challenge question about making better distributed decisions

There is hardly any difference with what we have going on right now on Ideascale. Why would a community invest in migrating to another platform that offers the same? 
There are similar proposals that offer a more in depth experience.

Interesting idea. For the mentioned purpose, a website might not be needed since there are other platforms already developed that can reunite people for this goal. The collaboration process could be a bit more detailed, and the possible issue with intellectual property should be addressed.

There is no clarity on how the proposal will improve decision making. Currently these discussions are taking place on Discord, what would be the advantage of having an exclusive website for breakout rooms? In order for us to understand the impact of this idea on the challenge, it is necessary to clarify the proposal.

Proposal aims at connecting people with different expertise with one another. As a co-creation and a learning platform, I think it's a good idea, but I don't think it is in line with distributed decision making process.
The experience of the contributors is sufficient however the plan relies on smart contracts, which are not yet available for the challenge's stated timeline of 12 weeks.
The proposal has some merits but without sufficient detail or plan, or evidence of creating a demo or building a team it is hard to see this being a short term success.

Specify the kind of relevant engineering experience. 
The plan is more of a raw concept sketch. It should be more elaborate on each aspect, accompanied by a roadmap.

The proposer is an engineer and a developer, so probably has enough skills to design such a website. The budget included an web design, which is good, but budget for marketing seems to be too high. Also, the need to smart contract creator was no clearly explained. These parts could be improve in the text.

The plan presented is simple, but there are not many details to understand how it will improve decision making. Does the idea described in the proposal require its own website? We are having several discussions on Discord channels and creating a new option can fragment the community.

The proposer is an engineer and developer, but there are no details about his professional experiences and expertise. I recommend more details about this and the inclusion of a link to Linkedin + Github.

Proposal states a plan, but not a very detailed one. From cost breakdown, it looks like at least 3 people will have to be recruited and hired to execute. 7000 USD are allocated to a smart contract creator and auditors but there is no mention of smart contract implementation in the plan.
The proposal doesn't describe what measurable statistics will be used to judge success, such as new members, use of platform, or number of decisions being made.
Enough information was provided, but not metrics were provided to assess the ROI of the proposal.

There is a detail breakdown of the funding. 
The proposal lacks a risk assessment. 
What if there are other competing platforms? How would this proposal distinguish itsself from those?

The website main idea is well explained, but the proposal lacks information regarding roadmap and milestones, as well as KPIs to make it auditible. Also, cheaper alternatives to web development should be made, as well as the budget re-evaluated.

There is no information to check how the proposal will address the challenge in a relevant way. The presented plan is extremely simple, there is no roadmap, milestones, KPIs and details about the proposer's expertise. Furthermore, it is not clear what the purpose of using smart contracts in this proposal is.
I think that the plan is not detailed enough, there are no real auditable goals and no timeline.

The proposal describes a very generic problem without specifying which aspects of the problem could be solved with the use of the Cardano Blockchain and consequently drive user adoption or increase the utility of Cardano.
The general idea (of being able to share and search for music) is cool, but it would be useful to deepen the aspects of this process related to decentralization and the use of the blockchain.
does not address. has nothing to do with blockchain

The proposal suggests the creation of a dapp, but there is no clarity on the importance of using the blockchain, what kind of information would be stored on the blockchain? How important would be a dapp? From what has been described a conventional app could solve the problem. In order for us to understand what the impact of dapp on the blockchain is, we need to know what type of transactions can be carried out on the blockchain and what type of data would be stored on the blockchain, so that we can have some sense of how the proposal will address the challenge

The idea can be cool, but it lacks an incentive. 
There is no mention of a ROI anywhere, so it would basically be money down the drain unless there is a way to make this profitable added in the proposal.

Unfortunately, this proposal does not provide necessary detail on how it aligns with the goals of the community nor where exactly the utility will come from. Thinking about proposal in these terms will help it nail down the scope better. It is really just an idea at the moment.

It is not indicated what is the final product that will be developed for this proposal (A website? A mobile app?).
The part relating to the design of a system to boost the music development as well as the one that talks about the development of an AI, seem to me very marginal and not adhering to the main topic (the development of a dapp).
It is not clear what the place of the "smart contract" is in the general picture and how its features will interact with the app in general and with users.
In general for a proposal in the Dapps Challenge it would be useful to specify the development architecture and the languages/technologies that will be used, a development roadmap, costs breakdown and the composition of the team that will work on the project.
and quote "I start play piano like 4 years ago totally by selflearning, and i allways search for a simple way to search and make music"

There is not enough information about the plan to understand where the blockchain fits into the project and without it there is no indication of success in the implementation. The proposer did not report any experience as a developer or mentioned the need to hire someone to develop dapp.
The experience provided is not relevant to create a database of this kind. Who would build it?

There is no information that would help us consider this proposal to be investable. There are no established experiences with validity in the sector - external links to previous work or professional page, nor any sensible understanding of why this budget and what it will accomplish exactly. Adding these crucial elements could help bring forward this proposal better. It really needs a plan which isn't here just yet.

It is not defined what the success will be for the project and no goal or metrics that will help the community to understand it.
For a proposal in the "Dapps Challenge", for example, could be really useful to specify how many users are expected in a defined period of time, how many transaction could generate each user with an average engagement and other KPIs like these one.

There is not enough information to check the feasibility and how the proposal addresses the challenge. I recommend that the proposer clarifies the need to use blockchain in this project and follow the Catalyst guidelines to elaborate the proposal.

No roadmap or funding breakdown is provided. 
Information on how this project would be marketed or implemented is present in the proposal. 
There is no risk assessment. What if the user base would be too small to profitably monetise?

Absent of roadmap and milestones - it is not possible to evaluate intentions here. Proposal is just an idea - not an executable format yet. Adding also definition of success metrics, KPIs, challenges, risks - all these basic elements will help it get better in the future. But not at the moment in case it doesn't get funded.
The proposal doesn't give any details on the data exporter,  the idea is good but not enough details have been provided.
The idea presented is to improve the quality of pool management and are not addressing the challenge from the point of view of developers but from the SPOs perspective.

Monitoring a stake pool can be useful for both the developer and user of a stake pool. There are software like this already created by cntools. I would like to know what you would like to monitor in detail, and how it would be different than what already exists.

This proposal does not directly address improving the developer ecosystem and attracting developers. It is operations oriented, and does not clearly differentiate itself from existing capabilities like those based on Grafana.

It is unclear how this proposal serves efficiently the challenge brief. It would help to add more detail so that it can be understood better. There is not enough information, cannot be invested in its current shape/form.
The proposer experience could be relevant, but unverifiable, we don't even. know if it's someone alone or a team.
irrelevent, if can't find existing tools.
There is no reasonable plan and there are not enough details to evaluate the proposer experience. I recommend that details are provided so that we can evaluate more appropriately.

Would be nice to have more concrete discussion on experience. It appears to be a single developer and not a team. Details on what sort of alerting/monitoring applications you have created in the past would be a great addition here.
The proposer has the requisite experience, but the proposal does not include specific KPIs or details on the nature of the data exports and supported dashboard tools.

Beyond couple of sentences - there is no real sense of executable proposal. It needs legs. It needs sensible plan, valid experience presentation, and budget with allocation that makes sense. Otherwise, this would be a blind endeavour. I suggest to work on it and come back at later stages.
Not enough informations are provided to judge the feasibility of the project.
The proposal is a draft and there is no information on how it will address the challenge. There is not enough information to judge the feasibility of the idea.
A plan, mile stones, roadmap, mock up visuals and more is required here in my opinion to see exactly what the proposer has in mind.
The proposal does not provide justification for its budget or details about the type of data export and tools supported.

In order for this to be a serious proposal, it needs work on roadmap and milestones. We also need to understand how authors approach success - what will they use to measure it, which KPIs, and if they are thinking about challenges or risks. These are just few key elements which would help alleviate concerns greatly. I suggest looking up mentorship program on catalyst discord to leverage some of that resource to help you.
submitted multiple times and hopefully the system would throw this out in the fututure. basicaly spam. problem statement not addressed - this platform is exactly the solution to the problem

This proposal reads as a nice research paper with no real plan/strategy to go from concept to functional dApp on Cardano in the next 6 months. There are 0 benchmarks to existing community networks or metrics included in this proposal.

Nothing in the proposal leads the CA to believe this team understands the actionable steps needed to bring a dApp to life. The project plan is academic and non-actionable, the roadmap could not be more high level and its never made clear who the specific developer resources working on the Cardano smart contracts will be.

Nowhere in this proposal is it made clear how this team will transform their idea into a Plutus dApp in the next 6 months. No metrics or KPI's are included for CA's to assess and the information on the website is equally high level and lacking true technical documentation describing the protocol.
there are no metrics, no benchmarking, no Cardano Plutus developers with Haskell experience identified and the link to the website provides no additional technical documentation.

Again I return to my initial comment, this proposal is a well written research paper but fails to make the case for how it will turn into a dApp driving user demand on Cardano in the next 6 months. W/o a complete Whitepaper/technical docs, metrics or KPI's the well written aspects of this proposal become hard to weight against likelihood of successful implementation.
The proposer fails to deliver a complete dapp proposal: there is no budget breakdown, actionable project plan or technical docs describing this protocol included in the proposal or attachments.

I really like the idea of bringing do-gooders together in one place, connecting our community with other change-maker communities, bringing organizations and businesses in and incentivizing the whole thing with a native Cardano token. I also like the focus on leadership / teamwork / facilitation.

The rest of it... still needs work. Not too stoked about the name... and ,frankly: the website needs to be done properly.

While this proposal is well thought out, it doesn't address this challenge's goal of increasing the effectiveness of distributed decision making. The proposal doesn't demonstrate how it will make an improvement in community confidence or engagement in distributed decisions.

All of the objectives of social collaboration can be reached using existing collaboration platforms like Trello, Asana, Jira and many more. There is no need for the community to fund a small part of what will be needed to create a new platform
The proposal aims at creating a platform to facilitate learning and co-working.
This is a huge undertaking and the team needs many new faces to be anywhere near complete.
The proposal is stacked with talent and a clear set of goals that have been well thought out.
Seems like a decent group of talent. But their objective is far beyond the range of funding they can expect to get from the Cardano Community. Especially to re-invent the wheel.

The proposal is asking for the full value of the fund, so it should be expected that they solve the totality of the challenge alone, without other proposals. I don't think that their solution is all encompassing and I don't think that, in the next two rounds, it will make a big difference for Cardano. There are no clearly unambiguously stated auditable goals.
Proper budget and clear metrics are needed.
The proposal fails to demonstrate a measure for success against the goal of increasing participation and confidence in distributed decision making.
YEs the proposal does provide enough information to assess the feasibility/

Again, the plan is too general, I would like to see detailed breakdown of goals, costs and a timeline we can follow. Proposer is asking for the full value of the fund, so the standard needs to be very high.

The proposal presented lacks details that allow measuring the impact in addressing the challenge. In theory, a loan dapp has enormous potential to address the challenge, but a minimum rationale needed to indicate the idea and the value proposition wasn't provided. What mechanism ensures that a borrower accepts a loan and never repays it? Why would anyone lend money without any guarantee that they will be paid back? These are basic concepts that need to be present even before an MVP.

How will the identity of users be assessed? Will there be KYC? Undercolateralized loans require some form of trust, it is not possible to use only smart contracts with no identity association, as some credit recovery mechanism needs to exist and blockchain addresses alone guarantee pseudo anonymity.

The proposal does not address the challenge of "How can application developers drive adoption of Cardano in 2021?" in the best way. It proposes "The $40,000 would deliver the ability for users to create a wallet and transfer native assets between users.", however this capabilities already exist with the Daedalus wallet and Yoroi. It is unclear to me what would the funds be spent on. As another part of the proposal states "We require the funding to fulfil development of the MVP and demonstrate viability of the project and demonstrate the use case for similar dapps in emerging economies in future. "
Great idea and in line with Cardano's vision in reaching small communities and providing them with services that would otherwise be unavailable for them.

Would have liked to learn more how this proposal ties into cardano ecosystem exactly. Where the community stands to gain and how it aligns with the over goal. I understand the basic premise of financial enablement - through defi. But greater emphasis on how cardano helps elevate this proposal/idea would be useful. In its current form - it seems deficient in information provided/or lack there of. Hopefully more can be added later on so we can invite this proposal back for funding.

There is no indication that the proposers have experience with developing smart contracts and with blockchain, considering that the challenge is to create a dapp, I think it is important that this can be clarified.

There is no reasonable plan and considering that the proposal asks for a budget of $ 40,000 for an MVP I believe that a detailed plan is crucial to measure the chances of success.

The plan is to "facilitate decentralised access to credit for individuals who otherwise don't have access to traditional credit sources." However, this idea is not fully fleshed out and lack critical detail in terms of experience and milestones, deliverables and KPIs for me to be able to assess that "it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully"
It is unclear how large the community is that you are targetting in Kenya. So it is hard to determine the initial impact and a ROI.

Unfortunately, there is no sensible budget breakdown. Neither in the proposal - nor on the website itself. It would be really useful to understand how are you going to spend this money better. It helps with accountability towards the community and helps you navigate the needs better. Overall - the concept reads more like an idea and it doesn't seem to have all the basic elements that we'd need as community to understand whether we can go forward with investing or not. That lack of sensible plan is a bit crucial. I feel this is a comms break down of sorts. I would suggest to take the elements available and mash them into a pitch deck of sorts where these points can be addressed more effectively. As proposal here has very little details and website isn't great to navigate either.

There is not enough information to certify the viability. A budget of $ 40,000 was requested for an MVP and no metrics or KPIs were presented for verification of success. There is no roadmap or milestones. I recommend including this information so that we can understand how the proposal addresses the challenge.

The proposal reads more like a general idea and concept, not a specific plan and it is difficult to confirm its feasibility and to confirm that it effectively addresses the challenge. It would have been good if the proposer included more information about the "specific community in Kenya that is already identified"

There is extensive information on the team, but the proposal lacks a risk assessment. Especially since it would be operating in regions of potential political instability. 
A roadmap would make the direction that this project wants to go to more clear and what emerging economies it would target in the future.

There is a roadmap outlined on the website attached but it really doesn't give us a sense of more detailed deliverables. It also states that working product should be available in Q1 which is about to end in few days. When clicking on either of links - Apple store or Android - both are broken and land on generic wix error page. Some clarity about timelines would then be really desirable as I am unsure where this proposal here lands exactly then. it states it shoots for MVP - but that means - based on roadmap - that some working prototype is ready? Couldn't figure that out exactly. I would also have loved to learn more about challenges and risks from perspective of authors. I couldn't phantom much of it in the current form.
It does seem to address the challenge effectively.
third multiple entery. challenge redundent to ideascale and not needed
While a worthy project in its own right, I don't think this proposal directly addresses the challenge, except in terms of outreach.
This proposal focuses on creating a new use case for volunteering based on tokenomics, which is not at all focused on improving the value individuals provide to catalyst.

The proposer aims to build a federated network to facilitate volunteer participation in all areas, this does not satisfy the category challenge, since it does not target community members wanting to participate in Catalyst.
The proposers and his team appear to have experience.  No way to validate credentials currently but assuming all checks out I assume you have a well-experienced team to begin work on this project.
This group has proposed several other proposals using a similar template. It is possible that the best challenge is in the areas of DApps and integrations rather than this challenge.

The proposal will reward volunteers with tokens for their participation, which is a form of payment. This raises significant legal issues in various countries since it would be unreported taxable income. However, the team does have a budget for legal resources to tackle this issue.

The proposer appears to be working in a team of 3 experienced individuals, increasing their chance of success, whether with community support or without. Given the fact that this is posted in a wrong category, the proposer might find success in the later funds. The team should consider requesting smaller amount of funding due to other proposals in the category.

Seems it is tough to understand how feasible it is and as much as I would like to see its success, I am unsure how it will sustain itself or if it is expecting to continue to be funded through catalyst.  An end-goal for financial stability to become self-sustaining I think would be a nice addition to this project, otherwise, I do like the proposal.
The definition of success doesn't relate back to the metrics most meaningful for the challenge.

The proposal includes a well thought out plan and a team of identified contributors, giving credibility to the plan. A measurement for success of the project's improvement on individual contributor's value to catalyst has not been identified.

The proposal includes detailed information on budget and timeline breakdown as well as measurable KPIs. The team has defined their problem statement, solution and target audience, which helps understanding their proposal better. They could benefit from a more organized, cohesive presentation.
Having a tool like PoolTool.io will be interesting for testnet. Good proposal.
Yes, this proposal is more oriented to developers, which helps to attract developers coming to cardano

PoolTool has been an important tool for the Cardano community, including developers. The inclusion of a version of PoolTool for TestNet addresses the challenge as it will be a useful tool for different metrics / APIs.

It's hard not to award top marks for a proposal that was A) requested by an IOG team member and B) proposed by the existing PoolTool Mainnet provider. Given I use pooltool.io regularly, I am confident the team know what they are doing and that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
It would be highly important to have tools which are used on main net to be available on test net as well.
very strong team behind this proposal and a must have

I like the general idea - but I don't understand why problem statement reads as following "Samuel from IOHK has requested..." That doesn't seem to be fitting the form? I would have liked to learn more about benefits of supporting pooltool for testnet to the greater community. I can assume what these can be but some effort within the proposal itself would have been nice. E.g. we see great need to support tools for SPOs who run testnet operation when testing elements for main net. By enabling these tools - we are able to help test features on Cardano and make them that much better" or something like that - not that Samuel has asked and that's why we are here...makes sense, right? Bottom line - it would have been greater if authors started with explaining why testnet is important and pool tools participation vital in it. That would have set the tone a bit better.
The pooltool team has already proven their experience with pooltool.io on mainnet. I don't see  how deploying the same tool for the testnet would fail.
Since pooltool team already has good experience building explorer, testnet version of it won't be much effort for them

The proposal doesn't involve relevant complexity, only the need to fund servers for the expansion of the services provided by Pooltool. The proposal was created by the Pooltool team itself, which is extremely capable.
As above, it's hard to argue that this proposal won't be implemented successfully.
pooltool was one of the first product on the cardano ecosystem so there is no doubt that proposal will be implemented.

Would have preferred more effort put into the proposal outlining in greater detail the needs. This feels a bit more like throwing a dart at the target seeing where it lands? I really don't get why it all rests on Samuel who has no part in pooltool on whether this thing runs or not. That is awkward  presentation. It seems not respectful of the process much. On the other hand, I have no doubt that pooltool team is very competent to run this - very smart group - but this proposal just reads incomplete in light of expectations. So I am willing to offer benefit of doubt. The thing is - this might just get funded given how low of amount it is being requested anyway? So let's see - good luck and keep up the work.
I don't know the resources needed for a tool like pooltool.io, 500/per month seems a bit expensive just for server expenses, but time for deployment and maintenance totally justify the cost.
The cost breakdownm technincal details is straighforward

The proposal addresses the challenge, Pooltool provides an essential service for the Cardano community and developers. The proposal is simple, short and objective, due to the simplicity of the proposal there is no need for a complex / detailed plan. The budget is clear and is intended to cover server costs.
The reasons are simple and clear. Extensive experience dictates that this team know the exact costs and requirements to successfully implement this project.
As usual pooltool team has provided sufficient information to asses the feasibility of the project not just that amount asked is also well  thought.

This is very limited proposal in its scope - so perhaps it is not necessary to have specific roadmap and milestones in great detail - but I would have loved to learn why this effort will be useful. How are authors thinking about success metrics. Would it be by number of visits? If so how much. Or would it be how happy Samuel is on scale 1-10? :))) Jokes aside - what are the wider implication of this proposal that we can measure long term? Are there any challenges/risks associated with it? None of these have been given any consideration in this proposal. Perhaps it is by design, but given on criteria we try to hold each proposal accountable to - it seems deficient. Few more bullets points, sentences would have done the trick, I believe.
This might not be helpful to attract developers to the ecosystem. This proposal does not the challenge in this funding round
As already stated, the proposal does not fit the challenge "Developer Ecosystem". It would be helpful for Owner of Ada but that's it.
nothing about this proposal furthers Cardano's dev ecosystem

This proposal focuses on customer experience rather than developer experience and growing the developer ecosystem. It might be possible to rework the proposal so that it provides developer tools for enhanced delegation tracking.
By looking into the team, and seeing what's already developed in https://delegationtracker.com/pools, proposal may be implemented
Many things are already in place. The qualifications seem to be sufficient.
The proposer at no point makes it clear how building a delegation tracking site is helping Cardano devs in any way bring new products to market.
The proposal seems overly ambitious for its budget--too many deliverables over an extended time frame--, though it does have a capable team.

1. It doesn't address the challenge of this round of funding.
2. There is no information in this proposal or discussions on how this will create a good developer ecosystem
The proposal provide a good amount of information about the steps that are planned to address the challenge, but as it misses the challenge, I reduced the points to 3/5.
Please see points above, this is not a proposal that will have a positive impact on Cardano devs at all.
The proposal provides a detailed budget justification and information on the team's capabilities.

Cardano should be available in mutiple languages. Spanish among them, though some numbers/justification could be added. Also rational for video vs. text translation usage and expected exposure would helpful support

assessmentNote: It is not easy to see where this proposal is really going. The areas "Problem Statement", "Solution" and "What success look like" somehow refer to different aspects. This challenge is about to improve decision making process within catalyst. I don't really get the point, why the proposed webapp is directly contributing to it. However, the core idea itself (supporting the WADA community) is an important one. But I think that this proposal fits more into the category local community centers.
This cold be in the LCC fund as well, but the mission covers both challenges nicely
Proposal targets the training and integration of African community into Project Catalyst.
The proposal description is not related to the challenge, there is no mention of how the proposal will contribute to improving decision making.

This team is very committed to their idea. It is not easy to rate / proof motivation, but the overall engagement (videos, proposals) of this team (WADA) shows it (imo). So I would expect a successful implementation. As I said, however, the proposed solution does not really fit into this challenge (at least I miss the direct linkage).
Great replies to comments, collaboration with partners and team members and plan for success
Proposing team is sufficiently experienced, plan is detailed enough and it seems realistic. I would like to see a little bit more details in the plan, though.

The plan described is detailed and well structured, but as the proposal is not in line with the challenge, the plan becomes less relevant. WADA participates actively and relevantly in the Cardano community, but it is not clear which WADA members will be involved in the proposals, I recommend the inclusion of the people who will be involved in the project, so that we can evaluate their qualifications and skills.

This team provides a good roadmap and timeline of when and how to deliver the results. For future proposals, I recommend defining the KPIs in more detail. This does not just mean mentioning "Proposals Submitted" / "Number of Trained Developers" / etc., it means to say exactly how much you expect. This makes it easier for the community to evaluate the proposed outcome. As I said, however, I think this proposal would fit more into the LCC category.

The proposal presented addresses the challenge, but there are not enough details about how the project will propose value onboarding. The Catalyst project has numerous aspects and complexity, when it comes to value onboarding it is necessary to think about the different parties involved (voters, proposer and community advisors) and how the onboard will be carried out efficiently. This proposal focuses on lowering the friction of the on-boarding process for catalyst community members. Catalyst will potentially see the impact in 6 months, well beyond the 2 fund timeline that this challenge seeks to achieve improvements in.

The problem presented in the proposal about the intellectual property misuse suffered by many video content producer is valid and could bring new users closer to the cardano ecosystem, but it is not completely clear which mechanism would help to address the problem.
An "Intellectual Property patent" could solve the attribution problem but it doesn't prevent bad actors to exploit video content without consent. I think that the proposed solution to connect to local authorities to validate and issue patents is hard to realize and these aspects greatly undermine the impact this proposal could have.

The requested budget exceeds the budget limit available, so the proposal will be automatically disqualified from this Fund. How would that harm the proposal's concept?

Although it is a beutiful idea and one critical to the asset protection in the Cardano blockchain more information is required as to the roadmap leading to its effective deployment. As it is it stands as a trust/honor system with potential to be predated as a search of all digital media/assets would need to be scanned across the whole world wide web to determine that is not taken from the other side of the world without the knowledge of real owners. Once is made onto an NFT it fall under ownership of a person that may not be the otiginal content creator. If its done through patents alone this project would be feasible but also limited to a specific jurisdiction and patenting body. The proposal does open the conversation onto the fact that more countries patent bodies could be brought after the success of a small case study which in practice would be great if art, video and other intellectual property could be curated before is made into an NFT and that would create integrity and value in the Cardano ecosystem against other competitors were theft is starting to become a decentraluzed crime in the virtual sphere.

This is a much needed solution to decrease the noise and to lower the barrier of entry. This could also make the internal process smoother and to highlight what is important. This proposal solves the challenge by enabling people who want to dive into Catalyst by showing where to find the information about Catalyst.
The bounty system allows this to be a project from the community for the community.
The use of github issue and pull request capabilities gives this rock solid chances to scale.
This project directly tackles the challenge of encouraging more meaningful participation by gathering disparate resources under a distribution layer which is curated by the community.

The proposal addresses the challenge directly and objectively. When creating a landing page we can facilitate the onboarding process in Catalyst, causing people to be redirected to their areas of interest through Landing Page.

The proposer is aiming to a create a Catalyst Landing page in order to organize and centralize documentation and information in order to help individuals do their research faster and more efficiently. The proposer aims to introduce a bounty system on community created content that provides value.
This proposal effectively addresses the challenge
I believe this proposal effectively addressed the challenge and will be a great way to improve the user experience for newcomers.

Its a great idea and a repository of knkwledge to all invoming advisors and members of the community. There should also include a Q&A for the most frequently asked questions found in the community then access for Advisors could have all the town hall videos uploaded as they happen throughout each term.

Never could this proposal's impact could have been more obvious than now. As  a first-time CA, I can attest to the scattered bits of critical info in so many multiple channels; telegram, discord, IdeaScale, email, twitter, etc. Don;t get me wrong, I've somehow managed to get to the info either by reading comms, guided by admins/my peers or by sheer brilliance (insert fluke). Such a Landing page with pooled relevant information could only add value to Project Catalyst making it more efficient and productive. This proposal solution is of tremendous value to everyone involved and even the odd user who may have missed submitting a proposal or failed to meet voting requirements. A one-stop shop will speed up every aspect of the process.
Yes, no questions asked. The team seems dedicated and skillful. The plan is well thought out. (Perhaps just remove the guest editing from Miro; I almost messed it up accidentally).

The team already showed that they are capable of building the project they are asking funds for, since it's already in development.
It is clear who is in the team and they are known through their activity in the catalyst community.
The budget asks for compensation of the work already done and for a bounty pot to cover the efforts of future development. There is a commitment to report what the bounty money is used for to keep the transparency high.

A site has already been stood up, there seems to be regular development cadence, support from the community.

I provided 4 star rating, as there appear to be many of these types of projects (Both part of Catalyst and among the broader Cardano community [reddit etc.]). and it is uncertain which of these projects can capture long term community support.

Certainly the bounty for contributions is a genuine attempt to remedy this issue, and the progress made so far is very impressive.

The 4 proposers are already active members of the Catalyst community and presented skills relevant to the project, which can be verified by the work that is already being developed. The Landing Page is already operating.

Reasonable and detailed plans and budgets were presented.

For the set of information presented and considing that the project is already in full development I believe that the chances of success are high.

The proposer is working in a team of four members, all of which have assigned roles and are currently active on Giscord. The have already started a page on GitHub and aim to keep this project open source. They have a high level of success even with partial or no funding from community, given low start up costs. However, their bounty reward system will suffer in the process.

It appears likely they will be successful based on the investments they have already made and shown that they have skin in the game.  They are interested in success and have invested time and effort into this.
There is the passion, commitment and leadership as well as the experience present and workplan divided for each memeber with a detailed goal and plan upon completion.

The team proposing this solution seems to have the necessary skillset to achieve its goals. That they have also been involved with catalyst ias community members provides relevant experience.Self-interest is a great motivator as CH said once, and I'm sure the team have clearly seen where their participation can improve greatly. The proposal has itemised each step of the dev path and have clearly indicated the distribution of the requested funds. The fact the dev will also be available and viewable in GitHub with welcome participation and comments would only further improve the vision. I like that the target release is for Fund 5. This project really cannot come sooner.
10K is a reasonable ask for this steering work (even with 20% covering "sweat equity" thus far). What is still a bit unclear is how many developers will be needed and for what functions.

The funds for the team is reasonable and based on their effort spent. The first milestone is already achieved with the landing page up and running.
The success metrics (issues opened and pull requests) are given and measurable and are relevant.
The project has very small risk since the work already started, the actors are known and engaged and the budget is reasonable for the value they aim to deliver.

The ask isn't large, if anything I think might be a little too small, however the proposal is well founded, a team has been formed and the proposal shows mature ideation.

Metrics for success (issues, pull requests) have been provided and are understandable given the nature of the challenge problem.

There is a lot of  information about the proposal planning, much of this is in the Miro board developed by the team, this demonstrates the viability of the proposal in fulfilling the challenge. The budget is also detailed and the team will leave expenses with bounties open.

I could not find milestones in the planning, I recommend their inclusion so that the community has a notion of time for execution.

The success definition will be monitored by issues and pull requests, but this doesn't allow a clear success verification. I think it would be important to add some goals to check if the version of the Landing Page that was thought for Fund5 was successfully completed.

The proposal includes information on budget spending of funds requested as well as a description of what a minimum result is desirable and achievable. The proposal could benefit from an approximate timeline before this project is ready to be used by community.
Yes, sufficient information was provided through the links.

The proposal expands on everything needed to produce actionable results and the funds are well established for the time alloted to fulfilling the tasks.Its a great idea and a place we can point out for resources.

The proposer has a valid idea for addressing some deep-rooted problems in the restaurant industry. So - potentially intriguing concept - but needs work in multiple areas to be considered investable at the moment.

No indication that the proposer has worked in the Bond market. No indication of a team. No indication of a plan. Just a number which perhaps mistakenly requests $400,000.

Not enough data provided by the proposers to effectively judge its merit. No budget breakdown and lack of establishing validity in experience are two major pain points seen here. This stems from lack of actual sensible budget.

There is not enough information to check technical feasibility and clarify aspects of regulation. What are the legal obstacles to issuing bonds in blockchains? Is there regulatory clarity? Since this reads more like a concept - there is lack of actual roadmap and milestones. Nor there is any mention how authors think about success metrics, KPIs, challenges, risks. All of these would have been really useful to understand.

The idea for the integration of the Cardano blockchain with agricultural markets is good and laudable. What I see in this proposal is an overly ambitious proposal that does not effectively address some important risks. The proposal is very ambitious in scope and as such may not effectively address the challenge at hand - the size of the project may lead to its inviability. The brief mentions questions such as - did we manage to attract users to the platform? Did our efforts result in new, viable applications built on top of Cardano? The focus of the proposal - tokenize agricultural products of Colombian farmers - is too general to take into account the specific nature of agri-food products (phytosanitary certificates, quality issues, storage, rotting, short shelf life, transport, delivery terms, crop insurance, you name it...)
It's an interesting dApp idea which would increase utility & adoption of Cardano if implemented successfully.
Good proposal. It fits the Cardano mission and a dApp to trade commodities seems to be in high demand around the world.

I think the three brothers and the mother are on the right track with technical expertise, leadership and the passion to help their fellow community members. The platform could be expanded on other countries facing similar social injustices around the world. The plan presented and experience behind it brings confidence to the implementation of the solution.

The proposal is for a nation-wide solution for Colombian farmers that is not limited to a certain pilot region or a certain crop. Even within apple production we have fresh apple varieties and industrial apple varieties with different characteristics and market requirements. The proposal does not address the complexities of trade in agricultural products and has many potential pitfalls if not scoped to a manageable level.  The team is a family with different skill sets, but it does not prove that they are up to a job of this gargantuan size.

Lacks many important details to give me confidence this can be implemented successfully. 
Non-exhaustive list of examples : 
- how would a farmer find out about this dApp/platform? there's a huge education gap here that hasn't been addressed. 
- how would the tokenisation of agricultural products really work? How will audit and evaluate that the product exists, the quantity is real, the quality of the product is at a good standard? 
- what would the market dynamics actually be? How would you attact buyers and sellers and what are the incentives as well as the check and balance for a healthy market to form?

The team seems solid and competent to tackle this. 
The plan is well built up, but there is one thing that caught my eye: 
'a fee can be charged that is a small percentage for purchases made by users of agricultural products'
By cutting out the middle man, you already gain a significant amount of fund per transaction. Would it really be necessary to translate a supplemented fee cost to the consumer or could it also work without?

Expanding on my first note there needs to be more clarity as to the access of technology needed to execute smart contracts and decentraluzed finance and perhaps a stage by stage roadmap delineated to bring more confidence to the table. The project is a beautiful idea and if it can be deployed successfuly is a world changing application you hot on your hands.

I think that on a concept level, the proposal does address the challenge, however the details are not convincing as the project calls for a wide, blanket solution for all/most (?) agricultural products. There is a lot of nuance in agricultural markets that has not been addressed and may easily undermine the feasibility of this proposal.

As mentioned above I think a lot more thought needs to be put in fleshing out the details, dynamics and incetives to make such an idea really work in practice. Without a serious, systematic and detailed plan I doubt this proposal has a significant chance to get any meaningful usage.
The proposal consists out of a lot of information and all the necessary bits are there, exept the risk assessment. I would love to see the SWOT-analysis included.

Problem needs to be solved:
Lack of tools and complexity to develop DApps efficiently is a serious entry burden for developers to enter DApp building and making use of NFTs.
The proposal doesn't contain a tangible solution proposition. It seems the proposal tries to solve the majority of the problems that DApp development poses today, yet there is a lack of a concrete (partial) solution proposition.
Community benefit:
If the vision of the proposal is achieved mainly projects migrating from ETH would significantly profit from an easy way into Cardano.
Ability to scale and address challenges:
Contracting of MuKn and IOG is pointed out, which would allow for scalability. However, it is not clear if the contract of MuKn and IOG is an intention or if there's already agreements of cooperation with these organizations. It is not clear if the team can rely on these contractors or of they are at risk to lift the project on their own.

This challenge is well expressed and the technical expertise is vast. The solution appears to be feasible and the stages presented look promising results. This project has the potential to help build the Cardano ecosystem to the next level once smart contract launches and the benefits of this solution will help many interested in the space to have a working structure in which to build upon.

There is nothing in this proposal that is improving Cardano's dev ecosystem in a meaningful way. The proposer fails to make clear how building contracts in Glow with MuKn is going to grow the ecosystem.

This proposal has nothing to do with Cardano developer ecosystem and is for the completion of smart contracts in the glow dsl. From the start of this proposal the author leaves the reader confused as to what they *are actually* building.

The relevant experience of 5 team members are presented, which cover mainly entrepreneurship and software engineering. Sources for verification of this information are unfortunately not provided. There is also the possible availability of a big cohort of 113+ NFT enthusiasts, yet it is not clear how many of those could be engaged and what experience they would bring. The availability of the contractors MuKn and IOG is not clarified.

Since there is no well defined scope of the proposal both in deliverables and timeline, it can't be said if the budget or timeline are sensible.

Given the breadth of experience and expertise collaborating in the team its highly likely the proponents can deliver on their solution. There are existing example of their work and the ability and interest in expanding with Cardano can benefit the projects vision and the community's collaboration.
There is no technical documentation, no metrics, no detailed project plan or any other basic required info needed for a complete proposal.

The project plan is too high level, the phases read more like a research project (and for a dApp not a dev resource) and the technical documentation describing how this resource will function is entirely missing.

The provided roadmap has no measurable metrics, timeline or associated costs provided.
The provided link to the "schedule and funding" leads to a website saying "coming soon" and doesn't provide a reliable source of information, since it could be edited at will. There is no other information available to what contributes to the cost of the project that is asked for in the proposal.
The linked github page has multiple repositories. However, there is virtually no activity on those at the time of writing except for one that has all commits spread over 2 days and multiple commits are done redundantly (same commit message and description).
No metrics have been provided that would allow to check progress of the project or it's success towards the Cardano ecosystem.
The problem has been stated understandably, I couldn't understand the solution clearly though.
There seems to be no risk assessment or possible challenges reviewed.
There are metrics, roadmap and stages to the plan along with multiple collaborators and clear vision of success. It's a solid proposal.
This proposer at no point makes it clear how partnering with MuKn and their Glow DSL framework is going to scale Cardano's dev ecosystem.
This proposal is lacking detail on top of not at all belonging in the developer ecosystem challenge to begin.

There are many proposals that deal with education, your special value addition is the spiritual/humane touch to it. Connect with those other initiatives (e.g. https://hpmeducation.com/), work together, synergize and make the magic happen.

It is a good proposal and challenge presented. The solution needs more clarity as to what type of programming language and can it be applicable to the ones used in the industry. Are we referring to Marlowe, Plutus or Haskell? is it a peer to peer lesson or learning through video tutorials with assessment for progress? is it a module based learning with tokenized incentive after fulffilling a level of competency? and more clarity as to the end result for the Cardano community will it lead to developments in the network, projects based in Cardano ecosystem or Dapps/Defi launched from Cardano?

Although it is normal and customary to teach with tutorial videos, this proposal is not suitable to achieve the objective of this challenge. There is a lack of concrete content and there is also no plan how this content should be created. In principle, the project proposes to finance the applicant for self-experience with other ignorant people.

Although the project's goals are laudable and would enhance understanding and adoption of Cardano, the proposal only partially focuses on growing and enhancing the developer ecosystem. For this challenge the proposal could focus more on the (future) developer community and a specific and graded sequence of learning goals.

Wow. We are the same: genuine yet little bit lost people trying to do the right thing. You have your long term vision but, honestly, I think it would be better use of your time if you would first join another team and, once you have seen how Project Catalyst works, try again to realize your vision via this or other means.

There seams to be experience in the tasks involved in the solution. More clarity as to the end goal for the community at large which are ultimately where the fundings are allocated to ensure a sense of return for the investment.

There is no plan and no essential content. For example, the methodology is supposed to be based on intrinsic motivation, but that completely contradicts the proposal to reward students with dollars. The own introduction with a video is unfortunately a very bad example of motivating and content-conveying work.
The proposer has the required experience and outlines an achievable plan for achieve the goals, though those may be to ambitious for the requested budget.

It seems that most of the time would go to one-on-one mentoring. I know what you're going through and what you're aiming for. Therefore, it almost hurts to say this but investing 6,000 USD to mentor 4 people is not money well spent.

The proposal is great and I believe a Fund 3 finnalist is working on similar tasks perhaps reach out to the individual and collaboration towards those mean can expand the results towards beneficial outcomes for all the community to gain access to that resource. There needs to be more clarity as previously specified as to the programming language taught through this proposal and the bridging to the community of Cardano at large.
Unfortunately, this proposal gives clear signals that this action will hardly have any effect beyond the four people. named in the proposal.
The proposal details experience, specific plans, and deliverables, but does not justify its budget.

The problem described is valid only for this specific period, but IOG has already proposed a tool to make the token creation more user-friendly through a GUI and they already planned its launch in the next months (https://iohk.io/en/blog/posts/2021/02/18/building-native-tokens-on-cardano-for-pleasure-and-profit/). Because of that I don't think this proposal can have a real impact on the user adoption or the increase of utility value of Cardano.

The challenge detailed could most definitely tackle some of the issues presented in the tokenization and management of Metadata. In theory once smart contracts are launched at Cardano that aspect would most likely fall under the managing body of those tokens later on. I fail to see the need of doing so for every token created of which most would not be used and from the other portion will be cutodied by the marketplaces and Defi/Dapp platforms build on Cardano. More clarity on the use of this protocol could shed more light on the solution and its potential benefits to the network.

I can understand the tool need - but I don't understand what angle is the author working in this proposal. It would be great to understand in more detail benefits outlined and how he plans to go about it. At the moment it is really just a very very basic idea but not much further.

There are no specification about the programming languages, the technologies or the project architecture that will be used to develop this tool.
For the Dapp challenge it is really important to provide technical specifications and a development roadmap in order to make simpler the evaluation of the feasibility of the proposal. It is also important to provide some reference about the relevant experience (like a link to a linkedin profile, to previous project, etc.), the team composition (if any) and the costs breakdown. Unfortunately all these elements are missing in the proposal.

Experience in the space is detailed by the proposer but further details about the tasks involved in the process are lacking. There is no clear roadmap or stage by stage plan to carry out the solution.

No information that would help us establish basic premise of experience needed to carry out this proposal. Nor is there any sensible plan presented. Most importantly - there is no budget consideration that would go deeper than just listing a grand figure. At the moment - we don't really know what we are potentially investing in. Adding those details would help great deal.

It is really important to provide a definition of success, a clear and objective way the community can use to evaluate if the project will be successfully implemented.
To increase the objectivity of it is important to provide some metrics (KPIs). For this specific proposal it would have been interesting to define a goal to achieve in term of "minters" or tokens minted in a specific timeframe. Unfortunately there are no references to anything like that.

There is little information to assess on the merits of feasability in this proposal. More clarity on the technical implementation, strategies and deployments that would solve the challenge needs to be communicated at this stage.

Since this is such a basic idea - it is missing elements of roadmap, milestones, any sense of success metrics, KPIs - how are we going to measure its progress - nor do we learn about what challenges/risks are seen by the authors. Hence, this proposal is not investable at all presently. Needs more in depth detail and perhaps later re-submission.
The proposal desribes a feature, that should be part of a product. No feasable solution was proposed. This proposal is cery incomplete.

I fail to see the applicatiom to the Cardano mission besides the point of benefiting content creators ability to get paid on the daily/hourly basis, I suppose that advantage increases the market effect use of Cardano Dapps potential that would make a competitive business case to use the network over others. The proposal effectively addresses in part the challenge posed but perhaps it can be used to expand on more than be used for a particular field and unveil a gret potential that could exiet if everywhere it is used as a payment system for all jobs. A Dapp that manages wages per hour and that the system just collects entry and exits of shifts and rewards the worker at a hourly basis no mater what the job is. The use case for content creator could be a great case use to start from a particular are and then expand to all work environment. If an individual is logged as working then pay should be streamed as per hour of accomplishing their tasks.

The idea behind the concept definitely has merit based on many examples we see in the real life. Democratization of earnings is definitely one of the key elements that defi can bring about. However, it would have been really useful to understand how authors are thinking about the whole concept in regards to bringing utility to cardano + how it aligns with the bigger mission/goals. Again - like the idea - but there isn't much at the moment that would help us judge just how impactful it could be absent of greater details.

The proposal aims to create a Dapp which removes some middlemen between content creators and consumers, resulting in lower prices for the consumer and higher payments for the creators. the challenge this app faces is within the adoption, how will the creators remain in compliance with a platform's terms of service? there are some large legal hurdles to climb that may hinder adoption.
Experience seems available but there is not a real plan.

Given the experience and the knowledge I can see that with the help of developers working as a team this could be successfully implemented. More clarity is needed as to the stages needed to get there.

There is no sense of information that would help us verify if this proposal can be actually executed as intended. Unsure how to find out more about authors - it would be great if professional links or past references be included in the presentation itself. Further, as presented - I have very limited understanding of how this budget makes it or breaks the proposal. Some budget breakdown would be very desirable. Also knowing whether this would be carried out by a team or just a single individual also can tell a lot. All of above would elevate the proposal greatly if provided in the future.
Based on the claimed experience and the proposer is technically capable of completing the plugin
There is no clear path stated toward realisation. No questions were answered. No cooperations or something else were stated.

There needs to be more clarification on the metrics and roadmap of the stages of the project to bring more confidense in the end results. Perhaps collaborators willing to assist in the development of the Dapp highlighted as well as how the proposed funds will be used.

Since this reads more of as a concept - it lacks basic elements of execution - such as roadmap, milestones, some version of success metrics (KPIs). All of that would help us understand on greater level where the headspace of author is. I would also add more information on how they think with regards to challenges and risks when implementing this proposal. But none of these are currently present in the proposal.

There are some gaps in the project plan that make it difficult to asses, including a lack of business model challenges like cutting out platform operators. There is no milestone plan or detailed budget on how the money would be spent.

The proposal has not considered the structure of the existing residential real estate market and so adoption would be almost impossible, unless they could convince major players in the mortgage and real estate business to adopt cryptocurrency as payment and settlement. So without addressing those concepts the proposal would not be likely to be implemented, thus not address the challenges.

I can see the passion and drive in the proposers but the project seams alot bigger than what the team vould handle in a short amount of time. Theres no metrics as for stages of development and how much of the funds get used on each step to create the solution. Another issue is the widespread adoption of ADA is not matured there on a institutionalized level and across the nation to bring in key investors, institutions and even securities. The idea could narrow the approach to a achievable goal in which the platform can grow along the key players needed to get there as the years pass. This would be interesting starting from Africa and perhaps with tiny homes movement bringing along sustainability and growth in that area to start given that is probably in the next years will have a whole system that will embrace Cardano, will have the ADAS, and institutional level will be onboard into adopting this proposal.
very competitive space littered with failed attempts any successful attempt would need to launch an ICO and have sizable liquidity

As mentioned above, the proposal graphic seems to be aimed at Multi-Level marketing approach to adoption, without saying so. That they do not mention the mortgage industry or fees for converting crypto to fiat for owners to pay down mortgages, tells me they are not thinking deeply enough

I see the passion and vision to get this through right from the get go, but a narrowed down approach to apply the solution to a small area as a case study need to occur to see the advabtages and disadvantages as well as the opportunities and the cracks in the projrct could be. When dealing with property, people and the system is much more complex to applied solutions. More careful consideration on the fact that the whole population doesnt know what ADAs are, what can blockchain do or how to get into that ecosystem. it is a complex topic and IMHO it seems a little lite on deeper content to deliver a scope for the 50k USD requested or detailed deliverables

The proposal talks about using 60% of funds for salaries. With no details (time/mmonths/rates/numbers. And as mentioned completely misses the mortgage industry in their picture, In the write up they say they are focused on graphics. This is evident. But commercial issues are ignored.

A more clear outline of the plan, funds and stages need to be communicated as well as the key metrics used to highlight those. More clarity on what the end result will look like and how is the proposer will be working on getting there stage by stage. More consideration on the considerations highlighted on my previous comments about adoption of the coin and education of blovkchain technology needs to be on investors mind when jumping onboard a project as proposed.

This proposal a focused example that doesn't misses the some aspects of the challenge. It doesn't include details on how it would grow beyond Deadheads. Even so, it hints at something bigger, a need for a repository of resources to study the history of decentralized decision making which is curated for the catalyst community.

Honestly, I don't know how to feel about this one. 
It's intriguing and I'm curious as to what might come from it. So I'm going to go with a neutral score and see where it goes. 
We might even get some cult onboard out of all this! 
Interesting.

Not sure how can this assist the community's mission other than marketing the vision of Cardano. Perhaps more clarity on explaining the solution can strengthen the challenge. I mean, it's a different than usual proposal, that's for sure :D But, if there is a system of governance and information sharing that works and we can learn from it, then it definitely addresses the challenge.

The proposer seems to be a superfan. With 5k in his pocket he'll go through walls to meet his favorite band and will let nothing get in his way.

The experience is quite vast and passionate and his understanding on his vision of success is quite clear. As the proposer says himself, he is a big fan of Grateful Dead and that's his experience. Plan is not properly developed, but it is pretty simple: get in touch with people around the band, try to learn from them and try to teach them about Cardano and Project Catalyst.

The proposal lacks details on the goals and methods of the outreach, how many people should the example of Deadheads be shared with in order to be considered successful? How would the cardano community reach out to Deadheads? How would the sharing between communities be measured?

I would advice to add an outline or examples of the topics carried out on speaking engagements and outreach efforts. More clarity on the pragmatic aspect of the philosophy of the Deadman examples narrowed down and there relevance with the Cardano's governance goal and where it can benefit it specifically.

There is only a general plan of action in the proposal, I would love to see the names of people to contact, and more importantly, a cost breakdown of incentives for reaching out to the Deadhead community.
While the problem statement is likely true, it isn't clear how this proposal will improve meaningful participation by the community or increase the amount of participants.
The Proposal doesN't make sense, proposals in Catalyst allow teams as well.
The proposal does target the challenge, with a good idea however doesn't go into sufficient detail or put together a process to make it happen.
It is unclear what the proposer is trying to achieve.

There is already a possibility of including multiple authors to a proposal. 
Additionally, there is nothing holding anyone back from creating an ideascale account as a group.

Its a strong and good challenge with little explanation on whats involved in the solution proposed. What is Xprize and how does it achieve the result needed to solve the challenge. More clarity on the specific activities and platforms used to tackle the ideas presented.
The idea's pitch is nice. However, there is an obvious lack of information. We need to have more information if we want to correctly assess your proposal.
This proposal does not have a plan to address the problem statement. Teams are allowed to form as it stands through various channels.
There is not enough information to assess the success of implementation.
There is not enough detail in the plan to expect this proposal would lead to impactful ROI
Zero experience or credibility has been offered to ensure that the funds are appropriately utilized

The fairly recent introduction of tags to assemble a team with requested roles already covers this issue. 
What is the relevant experience with XPRIZE? Are you a user or a developer of that platform?

We need to have more information as stated above, like what's your field of expertise? This proposal does not provide enough information to gauge it's effectiveness and impact for the challenge or what metrics it aims to improve.
There is not enough information to assess the feasibility and understand how the proposal can address the challenge.
The concept lacks sufficient detail. Recommend that the proposer ideate the proposal with a team and put several action points, together with key metrics for success
None of the above is provided, the idea was introduced, comments were given and no followup validates lack.
Not enough information presented to determine feasibility and effectiveness.

There is no plan layed out in the proposal to make a change to the current teaming system. 
Try to make it clear what you want to see changed or introduce.

A detailed road map or plan is required to expand on the team size, challenge presented, time frame and expected result. More details on how the funds will deliver its solution and what collaborations are needed to get there.

You definetly need to give more information. For instance, start by describing how/what your platform should look like. Add some details to it afterwards, for instance, "i think this platform should look like that or have that functionnality because this functionnality will help us solve part or the whole problem i stated in my proposal"... and so on. The problem identified is significant, however the proposal doesn't connect with the challenge's goals. The proposal doesn't demonstrate how the solution will lead to more proposals on ideascale, and it wouldn't deliver value to idea scale within the stated timeline.

This doesn't really help bring outside entrepreneurs into the Cardano ecosystem. Also, if one cannot use her local currency to buy ADA directly from e.g. Binance, they can always use services such as https://localbitcoins.com/ to first buy BTC and then whichever other crypto.

The proposer is seeking to increase adoption by allowing more people onboard into Cardano with their fiat. This does not satisfy the category challenge this proposal was submitted in and will not attract proposers in the next 2 funds.

The basic idea of the proposal is to make ADA accessible to more/all fiat currencies. This is not part of this challenge which aimed at bringing more entrepreneurs to Catalyst. The funds would be used to further develop the idea, which means that there is still no plan for implementation.

The problem statement states that ADA is unaccessible for people. Yet anyone, anywhere can buy ADA electronically on various exchanges by converting local currencies on such an exchange. A simple smartphone suffices to perform this action. 
So what this proposal concludes is just the creation of another exchange. Which raises the question; Should we really create a new exchange from the ground up when there are multiple initiatives of integrating with existing ones?

I think this proposal is very well defined step forward towards establishing connections across those areas of the unbanked and to further develop bridges needed to establish exchanges that help the institutions but also the users on these jurisdictions. Another think to consider is if this hasnt already been scoped by Cardano member at IOG as there are plans in place for that area and also if the need for local exchanges would be required if in the region exchanges, market place and loans are all carried out in the network. If local exchanges are required and havent been explored by African deals in the areas Cardano is working on then this proposal will be of utmost value to the community goals.

You have a big proposal/idea and it is good that you do a first round catalyst in order to assess the situation clearly. However i cannot judge this idea more for one main reason: there is a lack of definition of the terms. For a project with such a big scope, you should really develop more the idea.  The main problem is see with your idea from the start is the legal one, how are you going to tackle this or in which direction are you considering exploring ?
This is a very large task, with only one person behind it and a small amount of funding it is unlikely to deliver more proposers to ideascale.
Anyone can fork a DEX but starting a centralized exchange or peer-to-peer exchange takes a lot of effort. I don't see a team here who would be able to make it happen.

The proposer claims to have a CS degree as well as Marketing experience, given this skill set they should be able to partner up with other proposer who share their vision and bring their own idea to life working with a team.

The proposer provides a plan to further conceptualize his idea (e.g. interviews). But there is no plan to encourage entrepreneurs to join and get engaged on Catalyst (which is the goal of this challenge).

As stated above, I see no user base for such a platform as there are integration possibilities with existing ones. 
There is no viable way to pay for platform development and the installation of a legal entity with just 3000 USD. 
I highly doubt that there is a demand from the community for something like this.
It is highly likely with the experience and passion that the plan set out and the metrics can be deployed by the proposer.

Sadly, here i cannot give you more than 1 star. The main reason behind it is there is no metric to evaluate the whole thing. Moreover, when you state "knowledgeable people in the Cardano community" who are you referring to ? How do you plan on reaching out to them. Finally, you are aware of the ammount of work needed but you need to add more granularity to it. I can only assess a project if there are details on how to achieve the idea and the metrics used in order to measure if success is attained or not. So far you have the problem statement explained but that's it.
Unclear what the 3,000 USD would be used for.
The proposal is lacking information of timeline and budget breakdown to achieve their minimum desirable result.

There is no detailed roadmap, the proposer only explains, what he wants to do or what needs to be done. But there is no time frame given. As I said, this proposal does not address this challenge. My advice to the proposer is to finish his conceptualization before asking for funding in the future. Here is just a basic idea (which I think is a good one). But for a funding you should provide more specific details on how you will achieve the objectives of the challenge.

The 'detailed plan' is just a prolonged elaboration of the problem statement, trying to justify this proposal. 
It does not provide a decent roadmap, information on implementation and lacks important information as to who would host this exchanging platform and what potential risks include.
There is sufficient data, metrics and roadmap well detailed and very clearly defined goals and experience deployed in its approach.

I gave you 2 stars on this because you are only asking to do research in order to have, in another round of funds, a more finely tuned proposal. However, even with this draft you need to provide more information like what is the time period you are looking into ? 1.- Having a marketplace of ADA focused exchanges
