The proposal proposes to interact with universities to solve challenges for the local communities. Altough I think it would lead to a better awareness and potentially some new members of the community, I don't see this an effective approach to solve problems of the community. It is missing the topic a bit.

This challenge is about education, but the focus is on establishing community centers around the world to address local problems and achieve local development. So the proposal (education about Cardano) is somehow part of this challenge. However, it would be more fitting, if the proposer would have designed his approach around a specific region. I guess the proposer is from LATAM? So why did he not suggest collaborating with specific universities or so in his area? Instead he is very vague and wants to educate around the world. Normally you start with an idea locally and when it is successful you can reach out to other destinations.

The idea of educating people in universities is good. Although, the approach could be assessed related to ROI. The requested budget is equal to 100% of the challenge budget, and it should be described in more details, as mentioned in the text. The renting idea could be a bit more explained as well. Also, for easier understanding, the text could be shortened. Think that voters will prefer to read something more direct and well structured.

It is a bit difficult to assess this proposal because of its wordiness. It seems as a large idea draft that has strands pointing in many directions with some aspects thought out more, others still in deliberation. The proposal does propose to mobilize the community to solve local problems using Cardano, although specific universities in specific locations to be targeted are not identified. This is a weakness as it seems to be too general of a proposal that is not yet implementable. The proposal does not seem as if it is making a final decision whether to classify the "renting out of multidisciplinary classes in Universities"  as one of the different LCC categories:

Developers center
DeFi / DAO center
Business center (solving a local problem)

A problem might be that the lack of a dedicated LCC, but opting for "renting out multidisciplinary classes"  might not result in a longer term  LCCs, meaning that this renting out model might be ephemeral. Not enough specific detail and milestones and concrete plans for me to confirm if the proposal effectively addresses the challenge, despite the extensive text included in the proposal.

The proposal described addresses the challenge, there is a detailed and complete rationale about the possibilities that the proposal can achieve, however the lack of definition of some aspects such as which university could allow a partnership, the number of students and people involved and the lack of someone with knowledge advanced in Haskell / Plutus leave doubts in the ability to address the challenge within the established roadmap effectively. Having someone with knowledge of Cardano and Cardano's native programming languages can help to put together a more structured program in the proposal.

As one of the comments mentions this project is a bit outside the scope of the challenge. However you have a nice proposal but you need to refine it and probably splits it in other at least two separate funds. The reason behind it is that you mention onboarding universities (or maybe other educational institutions ?) but as they are institutions they are slow to move. Thus you probably split your proposal into 2. One for the onboarding of the universities and the other one for all of the material/course creation and documentation needed. Moreover, maybe add a bit of formating to your proposal so that it is easier to digest.

Renting a room and get in touch with an university seems the easy part. The stated training in various technologies and the mentor in these groups are much tougher to provide. The proposer seems to have non of these qualitfications.

The idea and approach of this proposal are difficult to figure out. The Proposer wanted to solve this by providing an additional graphic description (twice mentioned in the comments), which he has not done. Given these two facts alone, it is hard to imagine that there will be a successful implementation. The proposer claims that he has a lot of experience, but you don't find evidence for it (no links or references are provided). The funding should be used to rent classrooms for teachings. However, I thinks most universities that I know offer rooms for free when you collaborate with their programs/initiatives. In addition, a budget plan should contain more specific details, so that the community can assess if the money is invested well and if it realistic for the given budget to achieve the goals.

Renting university classes, if it is meant to happen physically, could have some difficulties that should be mapped. It would be nice to include suggestions of places, workload and some other information. A more detailed budget description would improve the proposal as well.

The plan seems to be too general and global to be deemed feasible. It seems to be still in conception and the proposer states: 

"For the budget of this project, I really need help :). It depends on the university with which the agreement is made, the amount of people that could be covered by the program, and the defined retribution for the R+D Cells, the Guides and all the backend logistic that is needed to accomplish this.."  These are all aspects that have not been decided upon - but must be already presented as part of a more serious proposal. They are lacking, as is a more detailed presentation of the proposers experience and team.

The plan described has several details, but it could be better structured due to the large amount of information. I recommend including KPIs and defining the budget. The proposer mentioned difficulty in establishing a budget, but it is one of the main aspects of the proposal, mainly due to the fact that the proposal is requesting all the available budget for the challenge. I recommend that the proposer provide a detailed budget (perhaps the best way is to address universities to obtain cost estimates).

The proposal mentions the need for training someone in Cardano's native programming languages to be the "mentor", this is a big problem, as learning Haskell / Plutus can take a relatively long time, which can make the proposal's roadmap unfeasible. One solution would be to include someone with knowledge in the proposal to save time.

I am giving 3 stars here because of your background. What i mean is that as an academic you know, at least partially, how acadmia works. Thus you have a facilitated access to some universities (if you are teaching) otherwise the one you went. However for the scope of this project, one of the first step would be to enlist a network of academics from different universities and countries  because i dont think that a project this size could be done by one human. Also maybe look at your university and try to enlist it.
Sufficient information is available but as I think the challenge is not properly addressed I give 3/5

The solution described in this proposal is not easy to understand. As I said, there are more (good) ideas than a real executable plan. 
The proposer tells a lot what could be done instead of providing a solid plan which could look like: I collaborate with university xy, I have/create this content (instead of just saying I will teach about this), etc. 
The proposer says in his description that it is very important not only the talk about "what could be done" but also to say "how it could be done". But he misses exactly the same thing in his proposal. He asked the question ("How?") several times, but the answer was mostly about "what". 
So I suggest that the proposer should further define a detailed and workable plan for future funding. 
The proposer suggested some metrics, but not a time horizon. So it will be hard to measure progress and success of this proposal.

The plan is described in a high level, and I understand that it could be difficult to be more precise at this point. But some more concrete ideas about the roadmap and milestones would be good. Also, you could include information regarding how many people could be impacted, and relate this to the proposal KPIs.

The author of the proposal in one of the comments states: "The budget is the thing that hasn´t been resolved in my mind, as this project would use the money depending on the amount of people in the process. So it can function with 10k o 100k or 1M ; depends on scale. But I've readjusted it, to the 50k of this challenge." The author is unclear about the magnitude of the project, how much funding is needed for the project and as such it does not provide me with enough information about its feasibility. Throwing money at projects can always be done, but the proposer needs to have a feasible scale in mind and include it in the proposal itself. Without a proper scale it makes it also difficult to assess whether the entire proposal effectively addresses the challenge questions remain about which direction will the proposer go with this proposal as many different ideas have been presented in the proposal.

The proposal addresses the challenge, but some uncertainties cast doubt on how it will significantly impact the challenge. To make the audit of the proposal more efficient, I recommend the inclusion of KPIs and definition of budget allocation.

I'm giving 3 stars because there are some KPI that i think are appropriate (your 1-3-6 cycle) which would lead to at least 2 MVP being produced. However, as stated previously this idea aims at a very broad scope, plus we have no information on the curriculum, you toss ideas but you should state them in a more affirmative/clear way. Finally the roadmap is missing, we have a roadmap for "if the project is launched" but not for the launch of the project You could start by adding how long do you think the onboarding of one university you target would take. The budget is fuzzy but this you state clearly. Maybe also try to work out a budget based on some realities. From what i've gathered i think you have in mind "modest" universities and the rental system would be not so expensive, however if you aim to rent a room for a whole semester at Harvard or one of the most expensive, maybe your budget is low. All in all we need at least one comparaison point grounded in reality. What i mean is "for this university which i contacted, they would agree to rent us a room for X". From there you could work your way up to a sensible budget. Finally, you should take into account COVID restrictions, which you haven't. How is your project going to go if you cant have access to the rooms because of the covid restrictions ?

The effectiveness of this proposal is not very strong considering that a project for algorithmic stable coin is already taken up.  

Emurgo already has an announcement for AgeUSD stable coin for Cardano platform.

Thus it makes sense to put the resources to other projects that will attract more people to Cardano platform.
The comments already state, that this proposal ist already realized by AgeUSD in collaboration with Emurgo and Ergo.

Stable coins are really needed in every crypto environment. As mentioned in the comments section, AgeUSD is under development, and it should be discussed the differences between this and the proposal. Also, it should be explained why a hard fork is considered in this case, and not something specific for Cardano.

Countering price volatility seems a good idea in principle. + the algorithmicaly backed stablecoin would be able to scale. However i cannot give you past 3 stars because, first i dont have the technical knowledge required, second i lack  information in your proposal or motivation of why you chose this stablecoin over another. Maybe add a clear part where you motivate your choice of Neutrino for exemple.

No experience or knowledge of working with Cardano based tools and platform is demonstrated by the proposer. Also, experience of delivering similar projects is not demonstrated.

Also there is need to explain the linked whitepaper (as it belongs to different system) at a very high level for the advisors to understand the approach and gain confidence on the understanding of the system by the proposer.
some much deeper research is ongoing in the community with very deep pockets maybe collaboration is a better choice
The comments already state, that this proposal ist already realized by AgeUSD in collaboration with Emurgo and Ergo.

Creating a new stablecoin will be an effort more challenging than expected by the proposer, I believe. The budget seems to be not enough for the whole project. Also, it seems that the budget is for reserves, but nothing for development. More manpower than one person would also be needed to accomplish this.

A more details of the  solution is required to further analyse it.

Example:
1. Likely challenges of picking up a protocol from another system and deploying on Cardano needs to be checked by the proposer. Example oracles for price and other factors and provide some inputs on how it will be handled.

2. Why 10% of ADA reserves will be used in governance as neutrino whitepaper doesn't suggest anything of that sort. Also, there is third balancer token that can be used for the purpose. If the user has to bear the 10% charges each time he swaps ADA to stable coin than that would be too much.

There is existing project in pipeline that seems much stronger making this proposal obsolete in delivering value to the platform and it's users.
The comments already state, that this proposal ist already realized by AgeUSD in collaboration with Emurgo and Ergo. The proposer did not answer any of the questions in the comments.

Goals are listed, but roadmap and milestones could be included in the proposal. Deadlines for each step could also included. When talking about stablecoins, who comes first takes a bigger share of the market, therefore the schedule is very important.

Here is what sinks you the most. Your idea lacks a Roadmap and Milestones (though you are focused on deliverable but no timeline involved). The metrics used to assess the advancement of the project is also thin or nonexistent (for instance are your deliverable your KPI ?) The risks have not been considered. For instance what happens if you loose interest in the project, will the stable coin not run anymore ? Finally, who and how the backing will be done (your personnal ADA funds for the start?, What quantity are talking about? etc...). You need to provide a more detail version the idea if you want to launch the project + (i think but i might be mistaken) that other projects or future updates are taking care of stablecoins running on ADA network.
The proposal is requesting funds to integrate their current marketplace to Cardano. With no real metrics or developer resources identified its hard to fully assess how much impact this app will have.
this proposal focuses on bringing real value to the world that happens to be based on Cardano, a great way to convert and retain users.
NFTs are the things which will boost any blockchain ecosystem, this project effectively addresses the dapp challenge in that prospective.

You raise an important point and aim at solving it practicaly + you have an already existing team onboard. However, i cannot give you 5 stars, for one reason: the scalability of the solution. So far, as i understand it, you are focused on NA indigenous communities which seems logical since you are based in Canada. However how do you plan, if your marketplace launched on Cardano, to onboard other communities and what are your criteria for "selecting" a community ?

the project roadmap section is not at all specific to Plutus smart contract development and its unclear who on their team has the Haskell skills needed to build a Plutus dApp
The project team shared detailed information on their skills to boost credibility, provided proof of concepts, provided a detailed plan with a clear budget.
the team behind this proposal seems to have a good vision and a good team to pull this project, and there is high chances that this project will be implemented successfully.

The proposer aims to create a blog to feature Cardano in order to educate a broader audience on all things blockchain. This does not satisfy the category challenge, and will not target proposers and entrepreneurs specifically.
Although this has a potential of attracting proposers this submission doesn't give enough details or specifics on how to reach said demographic.
How would this be different from the grand variety of indie podcasts and blogs covering blockchain / Cardano?

The objective of this challenges is to bring new people to Catalyst, so this proposal does not address this in particular, nevertheless educating about Crypto and Cardano is important. There are already podcast and blogs about Cardano. The proposer did not explain, what value he could add to existing content.

The plan described in this proposal does not describe how it will address the challenge in a relevant way. What is the strategy for reaching entrepreneurs and getting them to submit proposals on Catalyst?

The proposal could attract external entrepreneurs the minute the podcasts are online. So it is a very direct aproach that could realise a ROI very fast in the form of entrepreneur influx. 
The problem statement should be simplified for clarity. 
For example: 'How can we help people understand cardano? '
The proposer appears to have experience in the matter, and could very well achieve their task alone. The execution and audience reach will take time, and will not come in time for the next two funds.
The proposer's CV and existing website doesn't provide enough evidence of the experience required by this proposal.
Probably you will be successful with whatever you set out to do.

The proposer states that he is a writer and already has a blog. But he said nothing about the important point: if he is able to reach a relevant number of people with his content. Therefore, the reference itself is not really meaningful. However, the budget plan sounds reasonable. But overall, there is no specific plan about how to bring new people to Catalyst.

The plan presented, despite being clear and objective, is not in line with the challenge.

Considering that the idea is to create a podcast and blog about Cardano, I think it is essential that the proposer describe his knowledge with blockchain technology and about Cardano, there is no relevant  information about this in the proposal description or in the links presented, it is not possible to evaluate the qualifications of the proposer for execute the proposal efficiently.

The proposer has relevant experience to embark on this journey. Yet to assess this in a decent manner, current website traffic should be included in the information to get an idea of how many people it would initially reach.
The proposer provides sufficient information on the budget breakdown but comes short on providing information about deliverables, KPIs, or an approximate timeline for the project.
The items in the budget are unnecessary given the description in this proposal.
What would be your reach? How does this solve the challenge and help bring outside entrepreneurs into PC? What is your plan?

The proposer does not provide any milestones or metrics to measure the progress and success of his actions. For what period is the budget? How many podcasts will he record? How many people does he want to reach? All-in-all, the described solution does not directly aim at the objective of this challenge.

The information described suggests that the proposal doesn't address the challenge in a relevant way. Disregarding the fact that the proposal doesn'tt address the challenge, there are still some important points to be highlighted, the proposal doesn't present metrics for evaluating success and KPIs. I recommend that the proposal be submitted to an appropriate challenge, as there is potential. I also recommend the inclusion of the information that I mentioned earlier and that the proposal follow the guidelines and documentation of Catalyst.

It needs a roadmap to know at what moment and in what fashion the advertising campaign would take place. 
How long would the podcast series be? Is it continuous or a limited series?

The proposal does propose a solution for increased integrations that will increase utility & adoption of Cardano. However, the campaign brief for this challenge calls for "Quality Dapps and integrations" and as the Onomy token and platform does not seem to be fully established yet (tokens coming in Q2, according to interview on Youtube with Onomy's Lalo), it is hard to judge the Quality aspect in advance. 

The problem statement by the proposer states that: "The cost of no bridges is the inability for ADA to access established DeFi ecosystems." However, Onomy does not seem to be an established DeFi ecosystem, rather a DeFi ecosystem that is to be established.

This proposal aligns with the challenge by linking the Cardano and Onomy technologies together. It isn't clear from the proposal or linked documents which technique or mechanism that will be used to create this bridge.

Great use case that could help alleviate the greater goal of increasing utility with Cardano. Removing friction points is very desirable. However, I would have loved more information about current status of Onomy network that could highlight the interoperability. Some quick online research has yielded results but having that in proposal directly would have been super. In an effort to add more weight to the proposal.
interoperability and Defi are the 2 things which will get benefited just by this single dapp.
the information provided is very compelling and states the case clearly and professionally with a clear objective and scope
I think it is not a complex construct what is being proposed here and they team have already done a very similar project in relation to what is being proposed

I think that this proposal could have benefited from a more detailed presentation of the specific experience of the team that proposes to realize it. The relevant experience lists two examples, but provides no details. 

Also, the proposal would have been better served if it included a more detailed  plan of the planned work to build a bridge to Onomy and Cosmos. With the available information, I find it somewhat difficult to assess whether it is "highly likely" that the proposal will be implemented successfully.

There is a lack of details when it comes to the details on the team, a technical discussion on the mechanism to build the bridge (will this need to wait for sidechain developments from IOHK, is this proposal looking to help IOHK develop those capabilities?) Having some previous experience in the field does help.

As much as I like the idea of building something like this - I struggle with establishing validity of experience. It is listed there some relationship with RINA project - but it doesn't explain in what capacity really, etc. Or which SPOs partnership is formed with. Nor there are any relevant links that could speak to validity of claims. Such as professional webpage, profile, etc. There is only link to Onomy protocol whitepaper. There also is missing budget breakdown beyond one grand figure. Understanding budget would have been very useful in that regard.
team seems to be experienced enough in interoperability and its association with Rina makes it highly likely that proposal will be implemented.
as far as I can tell all information provided if very accurate and shows a high level of competence and understanding of the scope and deliverables in play here

I do agree there is sufficient information in general terms to assess that the proposal in general terms is feasible. On the other hand, the quality part of "Quality Dapps and integrations" remains open in my mind and I fell the proposer should have provided more in his proposal to address that aspect of the challenge. One of the key questions in this challenge is: "Did our efforts manage to attract users to the platform? " This aspect has not been directly tackled, as deploying Cardonomy might not result in attracting users - on its own.

The key question this challenge attempts to help with is capabilities which help applications that deliver a high amount of value for the lowest technical sophistication. This proposal looks to have this priorities flipped. I see a relatively low amount of value compared to other proposals with a very high amount of technical sophistication.

There is some basic attempt to define key elements of success metrics - but they are more like milestones as KPIs would need to be measured. Would love to understand or read more how the success is going to be quantified. Perhaps in amount of users utilising the bridge, volume of transactions, etc. These would be really good starting points for conversation. I would have also liked to learn more if there are any specific challenges that are foreseen by the authors when drafting this proposal. What are things that concern them and if they have any concerns or even if they are missing anything in particular that could help them execute this bridge.

There are many bridges built through use of Cosmos, so the team will not have to reinvent the wheel but at the same time if the bridge is created to Ethereum than the liquidity trapped at that chain can easily flow into cardano ecosystem. and since the team has existing product on cosmos this proposal seems highly feasible.

The proposal aims to create a news portal related to real-world issues and solutions build on Cardano. This does not satisfy the category challenge statement as it will not attract/target proposers in the next 2 funds.
Although this is a good idea, the proposal is a bit vague.

Yes, these things are needed. They have been proposed already. And there are some functioning prototypes:
- https://cardanews.com/
- https://adapulse.io/

Join those!

This proposal is about a news page about Catalyst. If the proposer could reach many new people, he probably could attract new people to Catalyst. So the proposal is somehow within the challenge. However, there are already some similar projects ongoing. The proposer did not describe, how he could add value the existing content.

The proposal doesn't describe how it will address the challenge in a relevant way, an informational website about Cardano doesn't actively address the participation of entrepreneurs in Catalyst and has a very broad approach and for a diverse audience, the focus of the challenge is on entrepreneurs who can come to Cardano through Catalyst.

The proposal seems to address a solution to a missing piece of the puzzle; informing more people about the on-goings of Catalyst. Whilst the focus on informing of Catalyst will be to those outside of the Cardano Community, to inform them of the availability of funding through this mechanism, such a site will also be of tremendous value to Cardano users. None of the people I've herded to invest in the ADA mission are even aware Catalyst (or voting for that matter) existed and they are in the IT industry. More work needs to be done to lift up Catalysts's prominence and this proposal seems ton be on the right track.

The proposer claims to have experience writing editorial newspaper articles and website development. They also imply they are working as a part of a team but do not disclose any team members. They could achieve the task set as it requires little start-up cost.
The proposal shows goals, more than execution plans.
Profile / CV is missing.

The proposer could not show evidence of his relevant experience. There is a detailed plan about what is going to happen on his website, however there is no plan how to bring new people to Catalyst. Budgeting is also not described in detail (e.g. for what will it be spent, what is the time horizon?). So it is difficult to say, whether the budget is reasonable or not. It is possible, that the proposer could create a great online magazine/news site, but the given information is not enough to see this.

The described plan has some deliverables, but without metrics / KPIs the website's mission is extremely subjective. 

The proposer described experiences relevant to the proposal, but there is no link for the community to access his work and have more information about his qualifications.

It's a pity that examples of previous editorial work was not provided or it would have garnered a higher scope but the team seems to have the necessary skillset to see this project through. It's a little difficult to assess the proposal given there's no 'dev pathway' required save for the site creation and hosting, which the team claims to have already prepared so in a sense it is really just the content that is needed. A breakdown of how the $6000 would be spent needs to be added in but on a related page, the proposer has claimed she is willing to fund the op cost of the site when the fund runs out and she is to be commended for her dedication,

The proposal lists deliverables but comes short on timeline and budget breakdowns. The proposal could also benefit from the inclusion of KPIs and a more detailed description of target audience/marketing strategy.
The proposal lacks information on how to assess how well it will acquire proposers.
How long would you last with this 6,000 USD? How many articles would you write? What other deliverables are there?

The proposer does not provide a roadmap with a time horizon and also no KPIs to measure his progress and the success of his website. I also miss a plan or even a statement about how to reach the relevant audience. It is easy to create a website and produce content, but it is hard to get visible.

The proposal doesn't describe how it will address the challenge. There is little information to check the feasibility of the proposal. There is no roadmap, milestones, KPIs, the budget is not detailed and there is no information on how long the project will last. I recommend that these details be added and that the proposal be written based on the Catalyst guidelines and documentation.

There are a few missing tidbits of information that would make me feel very comfortable that this is highly feasible; examples of previous work, web hosting info currently in development, and specific skillsets of the 'hard-working team'. I'm sure if provided, a rescore of this section will be more favourable to the application.
This proposal is a good idea. The only reason its receiving four stars its because it is not directly related to the challenge.

It is not a dApp and also the implementation of Cardano apps not not supported by this project. But it would benefit Cardano itself and users of Cardano. I also wasn't able to find a better campaign for this proposal in fund 4. So even if it does not exactly fit the challenge, I gave 3/5.

This proposal is for a very important visual online integration for providing better information to the Cardano ecosystem - linking directly to the blockchain-related information. 

I think it is a quality integration that will increase utility & adoption of Cardano.

For a decentralized future it can work but already the stacking pools max is cut by the Cardano foundation by the end of the month. But he has some extra cool futures to deploy(the creator of the project).

Great concept. Perhaps would have been suited better under ecosystem challenge - but I assume it will do here, too. Nonetheless - fan of such work. Having tools that help us navigate the ecosystem with greater capacity is always desirable. This would be a clear benefit to Cardano community at large.
Proposal is for additional features to an existing site with a well documented plan that is similar in complexity to what has already been done.
The details of the proposal and also in the video that was provided are convincing.

The proposer has the experience and a plan that is already under implementation with previous (pre-proposal) deliverables that have already been delivered on his own - and further improvements slated for the future. 

The proposal could have been strengthened even further by a detailed and fleshed out budget with point by point elements and it is a weakness of the proposal, but the existing developed platform indicates that the technical knowledge and motivation and drive are there.

Yes the project can work for sure because he has some nice extra applications. It can locate the adoption of the pool operators through the globe. But in my mind he will need a tracker because if I have lets say 10 pools by my self. I can have 10 through my family lets say me my wife my children my mother etc I find this project cool and nice especially if big corporations come to make profit of the pools.

Having followed the project for some time - it is clear that there is valid experience in delivering this tool online. Would have liked to learn in greater detail about other potential team members that could join in if funding is provided and what they could bring to the table. Adding that colour into presentation would have been very useful. Maybe a joint video with them of sorts, etc. In other realm, however, I must show my reservation a bit towards budget. It would have been very useful to understand how this amount is what it takes to take it to that next level. There is only one grand figure but no explanation of how we can validate various buckets. When watching the longer video - it does speak about budget lightly - but only in terms of getting more work done and other people involved. It would have been very useful to break it down in greater detail so we can see allocation of those funds on different tasks and what resources are needed for each. At the moment - it is a bit confusing and we can't establish that neatly. Something to think about.
Section about metrics and feedback information is clear and would provide valuable information about the health of the Cardano network.
The details of the proposal and also in the video that was provided are convincing.

I agree - there is sufficient information to assess the feasibility of this proposal and it does address the challenge of promoting integrations with the Cardano blockchain - as the proposal will increase utility & adoption of Cardano.

As i already mention above yes the project has a strong potential but it will need a tracker of ip(some kind).I will aks something in the comments and i wait for the creators anwer.(for the ip thing.i am not sure i understand it well."he has write Transaction ID" maybe this is a tracker.

I like how the author approaches metrics. Including ID references to understand how staking decision would unfold. That's very neat. I would have probably liked to learn more about at what level does author consider this a good effort. Adding some targets on how many people would utilise the tool itself, etc. At least getting a sense of where this could be. So that we can benchmark the utility better once this is deployed and funded. I would have also liked to see more detail in the roadmap vis-a-vis timelines. Which segments how long would take and hence earlier mentioned resource allocation to get them complete. That would add more substance to it. But in general - fan of the work - just needs a bit more data to make it easier to audit progress or lack thereof once funded.

I personally like this proposal as it adds new value to the Cardano ecosystem by proposing an independent on-chain vote solution. In my view it does directly address the Challenge - as it is formulated: "How can application developers drive adoption of Cardano in 2021?" 

The addition of a voting platform is a good way to marry the benefits of a public blockchain such as Cardano with a clear utility case - leading to the attraction of a larger audience of users

The voting in Cardano is a success of unimaginable applications. The use of the technology in these regards serves as an example of how it can be achieved, there are ways that it can be rigged with the current system until we have verifiable identities locked tot he process someone could create multiple wallets and accounts to stir decisions with simply dividing the ADAS into 3k worth across these bot wallets. At the moment there might not be a  reason to suspect it can happen but future more complex decision-making could be compromised to arrive to whatever goal desired.  As the system of governance grow some of these concerns will precipitate.

Integrating voting with things like identity solutions eventually will require the use of dapps, which when properly built are open and transparent. These are critical qualities for a voting system and so the proposal does address the challenge.

Great use case. It is one of the early examples of what can come out of the community. Knowing that this has been a pioneer project early on and without funding - would be very keen to see what can be done if extra help is provided from community. So love the concept - I do have some reservations with the rest of the proposal form but in different categories though.

The proposer has relevant experience in running stakepools on the Cardano testnet and main net and has provided examples of existing working "Proof of Concept" for Cardano On-chain Voting at https://vote.crypto2099.io (mainnet) and https://testvote.crypto2099.io (testnet). The plan is focused and it seems highly likely that it will be implemented as planned.

The community and developers involved in the process have a track record to show that it is a working system that will only improve tot he best possible than even the legacy system with the addition of identity, decentralization and security in the system.

Adam Dean is an active, experienced community member and SPO, and as stated he was involved with on-chain voting from an early stage. The plan laid out here is detailed, clear, and to the point about its goals. Being a supplement rather than a competitor to the larger voting ecosystem being developed furthers the likelihood of success.

Given the pilot success of this on chain voting during SPOCRA - I have every confidence that the experience needed to work through iterations of this catalyst app are in place and locked. Some reservations with regards to the budget requested. I would love to understand more if it were broken down into smaller buckets so we can better understand how each portion helps elevate the process and efforts within this proposal. That would have been really useful to see.

In my view the proposal does provide sufficient information for me to assess it as feasible and it does address the challenge. I would have like a few more details on the problems that might be faced and deadlines for deliverables. Also more information on the proposed segment "Attempt to attract real-world use cases which will hopefully bring new users to the Cardano ecosystem." would also have been welcome.

The proposal is really well detailed and the solution for this challenge is very important asset of the Cardano network compared to other existing competitors. If we can get it done here we can get it done out there with opportunities to increase the mass adoption of the technology to more than a cryptocurrency. Perhaps a roadmap of how this process can be integrated in real life and what methods would be employed to create a scenario where it is prototyped would be great to create a stronger case for this solution. Perhaps the voting of a region in Africa once the governments deployed the technology or a company example of a prototyped used to research the requirements, the shortcomings and the process of onboarding needed to be used in the process of getting there.

The proposal clearly describes its goals, illustrates how it intends to be supplemental rather than competitive with other voting solutions e.g. by targeting real world demographics that may be interested in transparent governance. It clearly describes what the funds will be used for and is requesting a modest sum. It takes into account plans for future iterations and has clear intentions of integrating into promising emerging identity solutions that will improve the attractiveness of block chain voting in general.

Some sense of roadmap is presented with section of what happens when funded - but would have liked to see more of what that looks like on the timescale. We don't have a clear understanding of when these milestones could be reached. There also isn't relevant attempt to quantify success metrics and which KPIs in author's view would be useful to track. These are important for community to track progress/success of the project in itself. Perhaps - number of entities onboarded to the voting mechanism, or number of votes cast, etc. These would be really telling on how desirable such solutions are. I also would have liked to learn more about challenges/risks (if any) that author considers in developing their ideal version of proposal.
yes at a local community level this is a much needed service just not sure how India as a country will treat crypto related products

I think this is a great initiative that could mobilize the community to solve an important problem. One thing that it does not seem to address is the creation of a community centre where locals can go to contribute or ask questions.

Nice goal and proposal. I believe the problem itself could be explained a bit further so we understand it better. It would be good also to understand where these farmers stand today, if they have access to internet and technology, e.g. smart phones.

While the problem statement and phase one of the proposal address the challenge of LCCs(Local Community Center), the rest of the proposal does not.  I believe the scope is too wide.  Because of this, the proposal does not give enough detail on how to establish Local Community centers.  It does not reference the challenge KPI (Key Performance Indicators).  It does a good job of highlighting the problem and I feel that Cardano (as a token and through a LCC  could be a solution.  However, this campaign is specifically about creating LCCs.

The project fits with the vision of Cardona for enriching real-life solutions and Cardone can bring solutions those farmers need the funding without any middle man. However. the more detailed solutions to the challenge need to be provided in this project including community building and cooperation within a decentralized organization where farmers can support each other and may exchange goods and services through decentralized organisations.
Honorable idea. However i think you should wait for smart contracts and IOG to build the cardano version of KIWA, which would solve the problem.

This proposal is great example of the potential benefits of cutting the middleman. But centralized government has a tight grip at social media platforms and cryptocurrencies to be used by the general population. Unfortunately exports are centrally governed and to be able to launch a solution like proposed bridges between the farmers and the demand needs to be communicated and the institutionalized governing bodies will need to be onboarded to these solutions. Internet access and technology needed to transact are required to take into account in the challenge as it can affect the outcome and deployment of the solution.

The proposal described has great ROI potential, but is not directly aligned with the challenge, the focus is not on the use of Community Center, I recommend that the proposal submission to an appropriate challenge.

The problem described in the proposal has a confusing approach. As I could understand the government is opening the market for private initiative, what in theory is positive, but with some minimum subsidies or fixing can be at risk, which brings uncertainty to small producers. Any proposed public blockchain solution will be towards the free market (and private initiative), allowing agricultural production between two parts is to allow the private initiative to manifest through a model without intermediaries. I only find it important to emphasize this point because by proposing the incorporation of agricultural production negotiation into the Cardano blockchain, the implicit ideia is to go in the opposite direction of government subsidies  and this rationale is not clear in the proposal.

The problem statement is not supported by the actual facts but just two articles, one of which is a news article. The problem statement says that new farm laws passed increase middlemen profits. It would be nice to give a comprehensive points list (based on facts) that support this statement, also in addition since this statement directly challenges the government laws it would be nice to be subjective about it and provide concrete supportive points on how an increase in privatization is bad in context of farm laws, rather than just providing some news article. The another article provided as an attachment  is from 2013 which is over 8 years ago and since then India has moved ahead a lot in terms of digitalization (e.g. a large portion of poor people (low income farmers included) are now banked compared to back in 2013 when any government money released as part of some scheme never reached the beneficiary vs now the money is directly debited to their account) src: https://pmjdy.gov.in/ 

Additionally, the solution to the problem mentions to solve farmer funding problems. It is not clear what fundign problems farmers have ? Does the solution means some kind of DeFi eco system for farmers OR does it mean that farmers can sell their crops via Cardano eco system? Farm acts can be seen here for more details, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Indian_agriculture_acts
This does not mention anything about funding problems

In general, the proposal tries to create a local community with farmers, NGO members and Cardanians to educate and onboard the local community in India. But it is not clear where in India, how many people will be adressed, which NGOs etc.
It sounds like you have the skills and connections to make this work. It could be helpful to break down the budget so it is more clear where the funds will be put to use.

The idea seems very feasible, although the challenges of including the farmers in the digital currency world must be addressed, such as access to technology (e.g. smart phones). It would be beneficial to comment how the budget would be used, what would be included.

This proposal does not give enough information about the team members actually on the team now and who will recieve the funds. Nor, does it give specifics on how the funds are to be used.  I want to know exactly who will be on the team and if the team is to be built, I want to know more about the proposer.  The proposal doesn't give the teams / proposers experience.  The plan presented is vague and out of the scope of the campaign.
Further information about the team is needed to convince for striving to accomplish a common goal.
I think you should wait for smart contracts and IOG to build the cardano version of KIWA, which would solve the problem. Then you had something specific they could use

There is clear experience in the delivery of the solution but when it comes to centralized government, access to the technology/internet and the laws involved in the trading process there needs to be more clarification how those challenges will be mitigated in the process of delivering the solution.

As the proposal is not directly with the challenge I believe that the plan presented is part of its relevance, in any case, a reasonable plan has been described, but the idea still involves the creation of a proof ofbconcept in Phase 2, because of this, many doubts arise on the implementation of Phase 3 of the project. I believe that it would be more reasonable to divide the proposal into two parts, First the elaboration of a proof of concept, so that in a second stage of fundind we can have something more tangible to evaluate.

The experiences described in the proposal are relevant the proposal described, but it is important that more details are presented, how many people will participate in the project, their professional experiences and qualifications, also recommend the inclusion of link to Github and LinkedIn (if possible).

1. The "relevant experience" section mentions a team but actual links to those people public profile or atleast the main person (e.g. linkedin profile) is not to be seen. 
2. Phase 1: Point 1. This phase explanation is not supported by any prior projects done by the proposer or his/her team e.g. has the team taken any similar endeavor in past that Cardano community can look at and be confident that team indeed has this experience? Point 2. This point depends on the premise of the problem statement that Farmers will suffer from the privatization and middleman profits. IMHO Indian government has a sour relationship with NGOs in recent years and this statement seems to be more inline with going against the government rather than actually addressing the concerns of farmers.
Phase 2 and Phase 3 makes sense only when Phase 1 is clear to the voting community. Overall, the statement and phases should be supported subjectively.
There is no clear team or individual responsible for the proposal. Thus it is not clear who will use the funds and if value will be created.

You have a decent start on the roadmap. It would benefit from more measurable milestones and estimated timelines for each phase. Some questions that could be answered:
1. In Phase 1, what specific communities will you target in the digital campaign. Are there certain demographics or regions that you will reach out to?

2. In Phase 2, what requirements must be met for the proof of concept to be considered ready for development?

I think the overall concept is feasible, but it is difficult to asses that without more details.
Roadmap and milestones are well described. It would be beneficial to include KPIs and the challenges of educating the farmers. Also, detailing the budget would support the proposal auditability.

While I think the need is great and the proposal does highlight that need, I am not confident that the plan as stated will make an impact in the area.  Only the problem statement and phase one address the challenge of creating LCCs (Local Community Center) in India.  I don't know the experience of the proposer or buy in from existing networks or community stakeholders.  Nor is there a budget detailed or explained.  I am not confident that this proposal would be successful.

Phases are clear further challanges and limitations needs to be outlined when it comes to training the community about Cardone use and blockchain. In rural areas, not many farmers are digital natives and processes which facilitate adoption should foresee.

I think this project is too early. Cardano is still missing the critial infrastructure to help the farmers.
When Smart contracts and the cardano "kiwa" platform is launched, then its the right time in my opinion

There needs to be more details on the political atmosphere of the challenges that come from replacing government levels and its effect on the deployment of the solution. Do every farmer has access to technology, technical knowhow on the use of blockchain technology, the support to take that leap and the connections outside the intermediaries to also take on board the contract through a blockchain solution?

The proposal described doesn't address the challenge in a relevant way, there is no mention of Community centers. There is no roadmap, milestones, kpis, details about budget allocation and details about the team and your expertise. I recommend the inclusion of this information and the challenge submission to a more aligned challenge with the proposal.

The proposal touches a very interesting field, agriculture, which is a innovation lacking field in India. However, it fails to concretely layout the  tangible arguments and facts to support their problem statement and solution.

The proposal provides a plan on how they are planning to adress the challenge. All in all, the plan is not very precise and rather vague. It is mentioned f.e. they want to create educational videos, but don't further explain, what their aim is, why farmers should watch them and how they achieve attention.

The proposal addresses a challenge that is close to the ambitions of Cardano in the African continent but I provided this score because it does not elaborate on how it will effectively achieve this. The mere mention of an API connecting M-Pesa and Cardano seems inefficient for such a proposal that has a tremendous upside to countries and a lot of people if the challenge is met. I would like to see more details provided. At this stage, I am leaning more towards a lower score but have rated it in the middle in the hope that further details can be provided to improve my assessment and confidence.

The problem statement doesn't present a problem, but rather a statement that M-PESA is the most successful mobile-phone financial service in the developing world, but no information has been provided to support this statement.

There is not enough information to understand how the proposal will address the challenge. It is only suggesting an integration of the ADA with the M-PESA through an API, but this is extremely vague.
Not too bad of an idea to meet the challenge, but he other aspects of the proposal are minimal and inadequate

Concept is great - bringing interoperability/integration that can help bridge gap and eliminate friction points are always useful. However, there isn't enough depth in this proposal that would help us navigate how it can actually come to life.
This proposal identifies an easily convertible group of individuals who are already familiar with digital money. the group is in need and is large in quantity.
It seems to me that M-Pesa is an existing service and it will more helpful if the proposal explained what API is.

The proposal lacks any development plans including itemised listing of resources against the requested budget. There are no milestones or timelines presented. There's also no examples of previous achievements or familiarity with this type of development.

There is no description of a plan. There is only mention of a team with skills in software development and business development, but there are no details of how many these people are and who these people are. The proposer did not detail his professional experience / skills. Without this information there is no indication of success in the implementation.

No real evidence of their claims: "Our team consists of professionals in software development and business development, with existing ties to M-Pesa's use in Kenya" Anyone can say that. No links no plan not nothing

There is no ability to validate claims and verify the experience listed. There isn't any professional link, website that would help us navigate that, maybe linked in profile, past work, etc. It would help determine credibility a great deal. Proposal also is lacking some basic understanding of budgetary requirements beyond stating one grand figure. The proposal addresses the challenge effectively and explores a very unique dimension to help new devs onboard Cardano eco system.

There is an overwhelming information available on internet on cardano but in order to make onboarding for new developers (college graduates/self learners including) easier

1. it makes total sense to have a standard google search always lead to a single organized information reducing the risk of new people turning away with an overwhelming amount of information thrown at them at first glance. (The software engineering principle KISS, keep it simple and stupid should not be forgotten)
2. Cardano documentation is quite good but also extensive which might be quite overwhelming and boring for new people. The proposer focusses on utilizing digital marketing strategies and keeping this information aggregated with simplicity so that new devs stick to the education platform and spend more time there learning about Cardano. As they feel more confident about the ecosystem, they can certainly go deeper via other sources, such as gimbalabs, official docs, white papers etc.
3. This proposal stands out as it approaches the problem in a unique way, which is, by utilizing digital marketing trends (e.g. google search optimizations, simpliistic beginner information).

I don't see a yet another website to be very helpful. That's why one star. Metrics are ok, that's why another. Perhaps add metrics regarding engaging with and sharing the content plus conversion (e.g. new recruits joining Project Catalyst or the wining teams, participation in possible crowdfunding etc).

No milestones are mentioned in the proposal but creating a website that solves the requirements might not be such a big deal. There were some comment regarding the proposal and the proposer did not make a single comment. I want to have this fact in one of the evaluation criterias and thefore I reduced this one a bit.

The feasibility of creating a website and making a list is easy with the requisite knowledge. The effectiveness of these funds providing long term gains is questionable without addressing the list of ideas and thoughts added by the comments, that were not addressed.
not sure how useful measuring number of visits will help at this stage.
It's a relatively simple proposal, well thought out and organised, it can be easily audited.
There is enough information to see that the given idea will be highly likely to be implemented successfully but the effectiveness of the idea will need more research, involvement and planning.
The proposal doesn't address the challenge, but the information described is sufficient to indicate its feasibility. I recommend submitting the proposal in an appropriate fund.

This proposal address the challenge of engaging Art community in Indonesia, which currently hasn't had much exposure to real day to day usecase in the country. Indonesias as well as their economy has major reliance on tourism and especially with their arts. After speaking with the proposer, I believe with the initial focus of being what he call a pool to art concepts, funding, and curator pool, this is a great jumpstart to the Indonesia community especially related to art and tourism. The main objective of this proposal is to bridge the gap between technology especially crypto with one of the most popular industry in Indonesia (art)

The wants to reuse outcomes of other projects. Like.

assessmentNote:
This proposal seems to be proposing an implementation of a solution that mirrors the abilities of a Cardano wallet (" a money transfer platform using Blockchain technology, allowing users to transfer money from one account to another without limit."). 

It would have been good to have clarified why the use of existing Daedalus and Yoroi wallets are not suitable for this purpose and what are the specific additions that the proposer is going to build. The Dapp idea does not seem to be thought out sufficiently well or is not presented well enough to differentiate it from standard crypto wallet use. 

Maybe the user-friendly Dapp has some specific abilities, but the proposal is not clear enough in this regard. The proposer specifies that the Dapp would be able to "2. Transfer money from one account to another using Blockchain technology" I am not clear does this mean money or ADA token? If it is money, then there is also an issue of compliance with local financial laws and legislation - which has not been addressed.

The proposal is very much in line with Cardano's goals and undoubtedly will benefit a large number of people in the African continent and specifically in Congo. Using blockchain as a P2P money transfer solution could resolve any issues in terms of the different currencies in the region and their different exchange rates with each other.

I believe this does meet the challenge of on-boarding new users onto the Cardano ecosystem if it was implemented; however I fail to see how this would be any better than the current payment system using ADA??? On board users onto Cardano to then move them to another payment system doing exactly what Cardano does now?? Why can't they just use Cardano??

The proposal describes the intention in design of a money transfer platform using Blockchain technology (also known as "wallet"). The proposal addresses the challenge, but what is the purpose of creating a new wallet? Why not just use YOROI or Daedalus? What would a new wallet add to Cardano's ecosystem? What would be your differential over current options? it is difficult to understand the impact of the proposal without these responses.

The problem statement doesn't make sense, maybe it was a typo.

The proposal would help people living in remote villages integrate in at least some form of finances they have otherwise no access to. By doing this on a blockchain, they would also be able to verify their transactions and eliminate any chance of corruption. 
The problem statement lacks a crucial word, changing the meaning of the statement. 
It should be:  '(...) and even when they do they DON'T have the control they should (...)'. 
Or even better: 'Africans often do not use bank accounts and are unable to verify transactions'.

To me the plan seems lacking in some critical elements in terms of team experience with Plutus programming and smart contract experience and developing Dapps. Also more information is needed about the viability of the Dapp plan and how would it be used and whether it would lead to greater usage among users - instead of existing wallets.

I cast doubt somehow with this proposal's ability to deliver given skillsets and experiences are described at a very general level. Also, in as much as the goals of Phase 1 has been laid out, they seem to be the kinds of activities that needed to happen in preparation of this proposal, which lends its status as being a step behind, particularly in comparison to other proposals. The activities described in Phase 2 are what I expected to be the contents of this proposal, hence the rating.

They are 'Highly enthusiastic and engaged group of local developers' and will be relying on 'WADA network technical support'.  This proposal goes hand in hand with Updev-Community-et-Cardano-Catalyst/342154-48088 proposal which states that the Devs are not yet up to the task and require more training/development. I believe that is the case and maybe this proposal should be placed in the next fund so that it can be a follow-on from the Updev-Community-et-Cardano-Catalyst/342154-48088 proposal and also possibly they can then answer why this would be better than just using Cardano.

The described plan lacks details that allows to measure the chances of success. In the attached file it is possible to check the team members and their positions, but there are no details about the proposer's professional experiences and their qualifications, I recommend that this information be added.

UPTODATE and WADA are involved in the proposal, but it is not clear which people will actively participate in the project, I recommend that the people involved in the project be indicated so that the community can evaluate their professional experiences and qualifications.


The described plan lacks details, it is not clear if the intention of the proposal is to create a "wallet" or to serve as a workshop for developers to learn how to create a dapp, it may seem like a detail, but there is a big difference in the approach of the challenge. One idea is focused on the development of a dapp to add to the Cardano ecosystem and another on the education of new developers, both are important, but we need to know what the main objective is so that we can make an appropriate assessment, as the metrics of success change according to the main objective.

There is high demand for such a solution and local implementation would not take very long. 
What is missing, however is a plan to market it. For this you would have to look at what is accessible for the local population. In Goma, I'm thinking the most effective way would be advertising on radioshows, for example.

The attached files mention development of an App (Android and iOS), but there is little information about the proposed DApp. I am not sure whether the proposer is fully aware of the App/DApp integration issues, however they have not been presented. Also it would be good to find out the rationale for using a DApp for transfers of value on the blockchain - in the situation where wallets are already built and maintained by major players. There might be a valid reason, but I would have liked to have seen it presented in the proposal.

The proposal does not provide enough details to enable a proper assessment of its potential success. In terms of effectively addressing the challenge, that is on point and is not questionable as tP2P money transfer is a problem which needs to be addressed and the proposed solution of AfriPay, on spec, is on the right track. This proposal could receive a higher rating if details of Phase 2 are presented within this proposal and to include timelines, dev milestones, the exact resources and the budget against the efforts. And I would expect the amount of funding requested will increase correspondingly.
Yes it does, and as such I recommend that at this present time it should not be funded due to the questions raised.

The proposal addresses the challenge, but there is no explanation for the creation of a new wallet, as YOROI and DAEDALUS could solve the problem presented in the proposal, I recommend that this point be clarified. Little information has been described to indicate the feasibility of the proposal, there is no roadmap, milestones or KPIs. I recommend including this information.

There is a lot of information provided already, but it needs a risk assessment. How would the local banks react when you will be directly competing with them? 
It also needs a marketing plan to get the locals to know the product.

Decentralized network ownership sounds exactly the kind of thing Cardano should support. This proposal however lacks detail and depth. Due to the fact that this is unfamiliar tech for most of the community here, it would be good to open it up a bit. Something like this: https://www.nokia.com/about-us/newsroom/articles/open-ran-explained/

The proposer is aiming to collaborate with network providers and municipalities in order to allow users to own part of infrastructure they utilize. This does not satisfy the category challenge and will not attract proposers in the next two funds.
The proposal is a draft. There is no description of a plan for how the proposal will address the challenge.
This proposal has nothing to do with the challenge setting.

You should list in the "relevant experience" your skills and knowledge to make this happen. Now you're basically saying you need "programmers, influencers and any one that feels could help". That's fine. Just elaborate a bit more: what is it that you need and what is the plan?

The proposer appears to have marketing experience but does not provide any specifics on how their skill set will be used to help them facilitate their idea nor do they mention any team members who will help them undertake this goal.
There is no plan outlined. There is no relevant information about the proposer's experience/skills.
The proposer has not presented any information on how to bring new entrepreneurs to Catalyst.

The proposal does not provide sufficient information on budget or timeline breakdowns necessary to achieve minimum desired result. Additionally, the proposal could benefit with a list of KPIs to help monitor the progress.
There is not enough information to assess the feasibility of the proposal and understand how it will address the challenge.
As I said, this proposal has nothing to do with the challenge. Even if it would, a decent roadmad/ any metrics or a statement about challenges are missing.

Yet another URL you have registered? :) This is a nice idea. I see a couple of issues though:

1) If Cardano is successful and if you know your Plutus / Haskell you won't need a marketplace to be employed. Everyone wants your services.

2) Building a marketplace takes a bit more than a simple website.

3) Limiting the marketplace to only Cardano developers might make this a marginal initiative. Could we include RUST and work with Parity / Web3 to make it happen, for instance?

Benchmark with an earlier idea (that actually pivoted to first figure out and build SSID Professional profile needed for such marketplaces):
https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Serv-Network-Professional-Profiles/333243-48088

https://servnetwork.org/whitepaper

I don't see why a special marketplace for Cardano-Developer would improve the experience for skilled developer and people that search for them. There are plenty of job portals that do this job very well.

There are already several similar Cardano developer marketplace websites/registries today, this is redundant and fails to benchmark to any of them or even mention the fact we want to use Catalyst as the process to bring those devs into Cardano.

This proposal is unlikely to increase the number of developers in the Cardano ecosystem, though it may facilitate developers who are already committed to Cardano to find work. The proposal is not oriented towards better tooling, documentation, or training. The proposer does not provide evidence that a Cardano-only work marketplace would attract more developers than existing general-purpose marketplaces.

The proposal does tackle the issue of creating incentives for skilled developers to jump into the Cardano ecosystem which will inevitablely lead to increased usage of developers building on Cardano. With the success of Gitcoin, it's only natural that Cardano has a hub where developers can create a portfolio for themselves and showcase their talents directly to companies/organisations with tough problems that blockchain can solve.

Giving companies a place to essentially hire/contract someone to solve their problem at cost to them creates a positive feedback loop as a company that utilises Cardano and becomes successful is a clear win resulting in increased usage for Cardano. In addition, developers are incentivized to continue building on Cardano as it becomes financially rewarding/sustainable to do so.
You are full of passion and ideas. That's great. Now get some partnerships done, build a team around you and work more on the plan.

No technical experience stated, but marketing experience should help to promote it. As it seems that the proposed solution is just a wordpress-site, It might be not such a big effort to realize the proposed solution.
The project roadmap is nonexistent, additionally the deliverables and budget breakdown with no metrics or benchmark to existing solutions feels very backwards.

The funds requested are likely not sufficient for fully deploying an attractive and compelling work marketplace for Cardano, and the competition from general marketplaces would be strong. Although the proposer has extensive marketing experience, the proposal does not including a compelling argument that the project would achieve the market share required to meet its KPIs.

More information is necessary about the specifics of the CardaWork marketplace and related functionality i.e when companies create public challenges like Gitcoin where skilled Cardano developers can solve their posted problem, create a pull request and get compensated for it is this achieved through escrow or does CardaWork act like a trusted third party? 

The proposal does come with a reasonable budget and timeframe for the scope of the project.
Ok metrics for a simple website. Needs much more analysis though.
The effectivness is a major problem for me. The resulting portals is also quite vague.
the proposal provides extremely little detail and is redundant in its basic idea to build another Cardano dev marketplace
The proposal does not provide detailed information about deliverables, aside from the terse listing of a UI and MVP for the marketplace.

The proposer is a Digital Marketer which speaks little to the feasibility of this proposal as we do not know the capabilities/experience level of the developer(s) hired for this proposal. 

The proposal however does in my view effectively address the challenge of growing the Cardano developer ecosystem in a mutually beneficially way, both for the companies who can outsource hard problems and to the Cardano developer who can become financially sustainable developing on Cardano while growing the Cardano developer ecosystem at the same time.
Not clear what kind of video would help with improving community or how it translates to offline
Not sure what the actual proposal is here.
The proposal has no linkage to the challenge. There is a lack of information about what the proposer wants to solve.

Basic idea is good, online spreading is better than offline, but the proposal might be better prepared. In the way it is presented, it is just an idea and not very well explained. Suggestion to improve the text in general.
There is no information describing how the proposal will address the challenge.
There isnt relevant experience provided. Need more info.
Who is the team? What is the experience?

No references, no plan, no budgeting are provided.
With the given information I can not imagine, what the proposer wants to achieve.

The plan in not described, since only the basic idea is written down. More explanation about the idea is necessary to evaluate its feasibility. Relevant experience is missing, as well as budget detailing.
There is no intelligible plan. There is no information about the experience / qualification of the proposer.
At the current state does not seem feasible given lack of information. Once information is provided we can better access. Try again with more detail next time please.
Whatever it is you want to achieve is unclear.
No roadmap, no metrics and no description of problem and his/her solution are provided.

A plan needs to be proposed in order to make a roadmap, milestones and KPIs. There is no information to support the proposal's auditability. General improvements in the proposal are needed, which come first then auditability.
The proposal is just a draft has no information on how it will address the challenge.
Good idea and much needed for the ecosystem to grow organically and get peopled involved in a more hands on way. This has been thought of already though so not full stars

The proposal partially addresses the challenge: it is aimed to train and assists developers but the problem statement, as well the solution proposed clearly refers to country specific problems and to local partners. Probably place this proposal, as also advised in comments, in the F4 Local Community Centers challenge would have been more appropriate.

There is no clarity on the purpose of the mentioned Hubs and what would be the contribution of these Hubs to the developer ecosystem. According to the description presented, this proposal is related to the challenge of Local Community Center and not to the challenge of Developer Ecosystem

This proposal aims to be a support group. 
This has been filed in the wrong challenge. It should be listed under 'Local Community Centers'.

While community hubs for devs is important and will improve the developer ecosystem, it is not in the correct challege for funding and should have been placed in the local community centers challenge.
Although geographic centers of expertise are valuable in furthering adoption and success for Cardano developers, the proposal does not provide details regarding type of support, training, etc.

Given that the team has worked to create geographic centers for other crypto assests and their website has a lot of information I suspect they have sufficient knowledge on how to set this up and there will be success here.

Based on the information published on the website the proposer proves to have experience in the field of "blockchain developers training" and also the skills and the partnerships to realize an cardano HUB successfully.
At the same time the proposal lacks of details: it is clear the main picture of the creation of hubs for cardano blockchain developers but it is not specified how many of these hubs will be realized with the requested funds, where they will be placed and which activity will be available in these place.
A costs breakdown and a project roadmap would be also really useful to better evaluate the feasibility of the project.

The plan described doen't present a clear purpose. What will be the mission of this Hub? How will this Hub promote improvements to the developer ecosystem? The proposal describes that the team is composed of 15 developer / researcher members, but there are no details on who will actively participate in the proposal, what are their professional experiences, skills. There is a mention of projects in the Ethereum and Tezos blockchains, but what will the team add to Cardano's blockchain? What are the team's skills with Haskell / Plutus and Marlowe?

The proposal exists out of an extensive team with relevant experience to provide support. 
The list of partners is impressive, but it leaves me questioning why all those universities would have a need for an external support group.
the group of proposers have already formed a community center based on general blockchain technology. This will be an extension into the cardano domain specifically.

The proposers' experience seems to be with blockchains other than Cardano. The proposal does not specify the nature of the support (individual/team, virtual/in-person) and the support areas (languages, etc.). The proposal does not quantify its KPIs.
More information on roadmap and mile stones would be appreciated, as well as detail on exactly how the money will be spent.

The definition of success is only vaguely expressed ("we think that 4 to 10 support poles can be financed before industrializing the process.") and it will be really hard to assess progresses. There are no explicit KPIs and no specific goals are stated (e.g. An estimate about how many developers/companies will be involved in a defined time frame).

There is no information to assess how the proposal will address the challenge and little information has been presented to indicate the feasibility of the proposal. There is no clarity in the purpose of the Hub. There is no roadmap, KPIs, milestones, details on budget allocation and the team's expertise. I recommend adding this information and creating a new proposal according to the Catalyst guidelines and documentation.

The solution to the problem is still too vague. What I can make out of it is that you would function as liaisons. Is that correct? 
A roadmap on how you would create these centers of expertise would provide a useful insight in this. 
I have noticed that you have filed 2 proposals that are almost exactly the same, just paraphrased. Could you elaborate?
while the goal and plan is clear, metrics of success are not clearly identified by the proposers. Such as, how many developers have interacted at the community center.
The proposal only vaguely provides quantifiable information for assessing its proposed budget.
It's a simple proposal for a huge market. This needs to happen in some shape or form.
