assessmentNote: It a really interesting suggestion for an application. The problems that I see is, that the main problem is not a technical. There are quality news that rely at least less on ads but they need to get the fund from other sources like subscriptions. Getting people to pay for subscriptions it hard and even if the applcation would find people that are willing to do it, I doubt that the "producer" of the article would have enough incentive to provide different news as they already have for their existing newspaper.
I think that the proposal has merit and is a good idea, however the weakness might be that it seems still to be a concept in development, not fully thought out.

In today's world, where there's lots of talk about 'fake news', there is need for applications that encourage higher quality journalism. 
At the same time it will provide confidence in Cardano and establish it as a trusted entity.

This is a novel use of the Cardano blockchain which, if successful, would bring attention to the ecosystem.  Demand for independent news (eg Substack) has been increasing as frustration grows with paywalls, so this idea seems have some demand.
This proposal sounds very similar to other projects such as DLive, which has some community following.

I like the concept. It has definitely a great use case that could be deployed with help of cardano ecosystem. Would have liked to learn more why Cardano is really the right choice from authors as well. The presentation most revolves around how it would be deployed but not too much on conceptual level of how it all aligns with mission/goals of Cardano. That link would have been better made in the beginning.
If successful the proposal would bring in news consumers to the cardano blockchain. it is not clear how this would the content creators would be compensated in this model.
I don't doubt the technical qualifications of the proposer, but there are many non-technical factors in this proposal.

The plan is not sufficiently developed in detail, while the requested funds of USD 50000 is a lump sum without a breakdown of expenses. The proposer has experience, but lacks a team and does not provide a plan for staffing the team - apart from general observations

The proposer seems to have the right skillset to develop this. It relies on solid mechanics that provide ROI. 
What is lacking, though, is how user adoption will be promoted. How will it be marketed?

The detailed plan and experience demonstrate commitment to the idea. However, the proposer is yet to start working on the project - there is no code repository, wireframes or sequence diagrams to consider how the application operates

Great concept BUT major deficiency in terms of additional information provided. There are no external links provided that we could look at previous work done, some references or just professional profile of sorts like Linked in. Learning more about people would end up building this solution is a key element that I'm presently missing. Going even further - I am missing break down of budget against deliverables. There is only one grand figure but we don't really get to understand how this proposal would benefit from that amount, etc. A bit of planning around that would have helped showcase proposal in better light.

the proposer has experience in software development however it isn't clear how the business negotiations would be determined. the dapp will rely on converting new sites to stop advertisements in favor of accepting crypto payment.
The article addresses the challenge of the technical implementation and engaging with news sites. The chances of success are very uncertain. The approach seems very reasonable.
The proposal does not provide sufficient information to assess how feasible it is - due to a lack of detail.
A roadmap and funding breakdown would make this easier to assess.
The proposal has been sufficiently ideated, is well structured and in my estimation the demand for the application is there.

There is some slight attempt to outline what deliverables are required - we can loosely consider these are milestones but there isn't really a roadmap that we can place these on. There is no sense of timeline at all. Nor do authors think about what success metrics we will consider as community once funding is provided. There are no KPIs suggested. Further, author also doesn't look into some challenges/risks that we could consider when implementing their solution. All of the above would have added more colour to proposal and make it more investable. At the moment - it is just a concept/an idea.
The proposer has great ideas, but it is unclear how many new cardano users it will bring to the blockchain. No clear budget, scope or timeline is presented.
The overhead of running a full node it quite large. It is good to have the possibility to do so, but getting started without it, would be a great idea too. Like Yoroid does it.
Blockfrost is a good example of the type of developer ecosystem products we need more of in Cardano.
Blockfrost is a great tool and this proposal makes clear the plan to develop a lightweight CLI on top of this.

Although a nodeless interface would improve the convenience of development for a significant portion of Cardano developer community, the impediments to running a full node are minor. For instance, simply running Daedalus includes a full node that can be utilized by `cardano-cli` and other tools.
api is already there. The cli is the only thing that is missing. Perhaps there are some adjustments needed on the way but I have no doubts that this will be implemented.
The 5 binaries team has implemented several Cardano projects before. That said the budget breakdown is very high level and there is no implementation metric included.
The budget breakdown and KPI's could be much more detailed in this proposal however the team behind this proposal has several ongoing Cardano projects

The team has extensive experience with Cardano and Blockfrost, and the project's KPIs are modest, so there is a high likelihood the project will be implemented successfully. The project's budget estimate seems appropriate to the task.
Knowlede of the members are sufficient, timeframe is stated and believable. I like it.
The proposal provides solid detail but its still difficult w/o any metrics or KPI's to describe how developers build production-ready products (not testapps) on top of this lightweight CLI
The proposal leaves enough detail for the description of the Blockfrost product but could include additional project details to support this proposal.
The proposal is sufficiently detailed, and the example output clearly indicates the level of detail that the CLI would provide.
Theoricaly it would be great for larger adoption. Right now i just don't see how could it be done for a decentralized system.

There is no clear description of how this proposal addresses the challenge. There is no description of a dapp in the proposal. It is important to remember that it will be possible to buy ADA directly from Yoroi through Moonpay, what would be the impact of this on the relevance of the proposal?
The proposal would make the interchange to Cardano much easier. It is not sure, what kind of application it might be, but if it works, this would be a good flagship.

Interesting concept - but there isn't enough information provided that would help us establish impact on a meaningful level. Absent of any data  provided, especially with regards to scale of the problem at hand - it isn't presently possible.

This proposal attacks a fundamental challenge of the cardano ecosystem, getting users onboard from fiat. The proposal fails to identify how many potential users this could bring onto the cardano blockchain.

The plan presented does not give many informations.
Such system would require to have a bank account as it work for an exchange like Binance wich is centralized. Is this bank account would be linked to IOHK or recorded in the name of your company?
Then, where do liquidity would come from? Are you planning to subscribe for a loan in some ways?

You were saying you " already created this kind of service with Stellar for a non-profit organization". It would be great to see how the system works. Can you give us some more information or link to your work?
A non profit organization is like a company, it can get a normal bank account with IBAN and so on, but i assume it's almost impossible for a decentralized network to do so. Still, i could be wrong, i just don't see how. It could be a problem for legal aspect too.

There is no description of a plan to assess the successful implementation of the proposal. There are no details about the proposer's skills, just the mention that he is a FullStack developer and that he worked on a similar project with Stellar.

I recommend including a plan and details about your expertise, links to Github, jobs and Linkedin. In general, I also recommend following the Catalyst guidelines for the creation of proposals.
I have serious doubts regading the realization of the project. The description of the proposal is very general and there are plenty of legal aspects that make a hell of problems.

Not enough information provided. There are no links/references that could help us find validity in claims and experiences. Nor is there any indication about semantics with regards to the budget. Not much to hold on to.
This proposal itself is a legal feasibility study and won't result in a usable product that brings users onto the blockchain.

With this budget, the information we have on the team and the lack of technical and legal informations, we can't really judge about the feasability. The idea is clearly aiming to effectively adress the challenge but you need to provide more information, if you please.

There is not enough information to check the feasibility of the proposal. Little information was presented in general, so it is not possible to check the effectiveness of the proposal to address the challenge.

I have serious doubts regading the realization of the project. The description of the proposal is very general and there are plenty of legal aspects that make a hell of problems. I like the aspect, that the legal problems should be solved as first step but there is not much flesh to this proposal.

Since proposal is so concise in its length - it naturally is missing a lot of elements we'd be looking for. Including roadmap, milestones, some definition of success metrics, challenges, risks, etc. None of which are included. Hence I suggest to add more depth of information to the proposal and try to resubmit at later stages again.
This proposal doesn't provide sufficient information assess how feasible it is that the legal feasibility study would be created, no follow-up plan, and no key questions to answer going into it.

"meet-ups" are fairly ambiguous and metrics around how this actually meets the challenge will be difficult to measure. That said, it seems to be a hyper-local solution from a team in tune with their local dev community.
developers in multiple parts of the ecosystem is certainly a major part of the mission and this is a big step forward to have a leader group like this building.

It is a fantastic idea and one needed to promote adoption and integration of blockchain technology for the improvement in the region while also opening the opportunity to tap into Cardano's long term goals in Africa. It would be good to show a detail plan of the topics of the presentation, how many times in the year it will be promoted and a feedback from the amount of people expected to join the sessions.

The idea is good and synergises with the sideproposals that are submitted by the same group. 
To improve this proposal, shorten the problem statement and fix the partially translated title.

The focus of the proposal is to bring more people from the community to learn blockchain and functional programming languages, but there are few details about the content that will be covered in this course/events and what is the expectation of complexity of the course and this makes it difficult to measure the impact on the developers ecosystem, regardless the proposal addresses the challenge of this.

The problem statement is subjective. Don't developers have ways to access information? There is material about Plutus and Marlowe available to developers, we can question the ease of reaching this material or the quantity and quality, but saying that there is no way to access this information is not correct.
Progress looks to already be happening towards this, just need small amount of funds to scale and add value.
Looks like the framework is already in place and this will get it fully rolling

Based on the proposer the experience is there to promote a basic format of the blockchain technology and the benefits and long term vision of Cardano in the region. This could create links and interest form other developers and Entrepreneurs on board other projects that can help drive the changes. No-one knows best that your own community how to organize and present the information needed that members of the community there.
Pretty much everything is covered in the proposal. I do not see any uncertain factors.

There is a reasonable description of the idea, but not enough details about what will be taught about blockchain / functional programming. As one of the defined metrics of the proposal is the number of trained functional programmers, it is important that we understand what will be covered in the course to be able to understand the plan and the mission in relation to the challenge.

There are no details on who is involved in the proposal and their qualifications, considering the fact that a teacher with skills in functional programming language will be necessary, it is crucial that details about their experience / qualifications are clear. It was mentioned that WADA will participate with educational support, but without knowing who the people at WADA are going to participate in, it is not possible to measure the chances of success.
Some of the hurdles were addressed i.e. government oversight. Really no way to ensure these meetings bring devs further into Cardano ecosystem and, again, the metrics will be hard to measure.
It appears that this proposal will be a great success at its own level, would like to see more of the road map but in its scope it is good.

Ther eis the passion to onboard others into the project and increase awareness to the solution. More clarity needs to be communicated as to virtual, physical meetups, how many in the span of the year and what outline of topics are addressed could present more confidence in the proposal's deployment of its solution.

The proposal has the potential to address the challenge, but some details need to be added so that we can understand the feasibility of the proposal and its potential impact on the developer ecosystem.

I recommend the inclusion of a roadmap, milestones and objective KPIs (reasonable metrics were mentioned, but without defining KPIs, the success assessment is extremely subjective).

The proposal describes a detailed budget, but there are no details on who(who is the teacher?) is involved in implementing the proposal and their skills.

All necessary information is present. 
My only suggestion is to elaborate on how these events would be advertised.
The proposal does address the developer ecosystem challenge by proposing an concept that will make it easier for developers to work on the cardano platform

As a developer myself, this proposal is quite interesting, as we need more resources/tutorial to learn about smart contract in Cardano network. So, yes, I agree that this proposal is effectively address the challenge.

There are several sources that describe smart contracts very well. For example Dapp University. I also like the MIT OpenCourseWare Vidos about Blockchain and smart contracts. There are several free videos about it on youtube.  They might not be sepecific for Cardano but this aspect is also not mentioned in the proposal.
It's not clear how the explanation to developers should be delivered and what's the success criteria list.

The problem statement and solution presented are reasonable and address the challenge, but there is no description of a plan, so there is no way to assess the impact of the proposal in addressing the challenge.
This proposal if implemented, may benefit a handful of devs who prefer 1-1 learning from another dev, but will not have much reach beyond that.

The proposal addresses the keen need for a larger variety of tutorial materials for smart contracts, but is not specific about which smart-contract languages it will address or the types of smart contracts.
Proposal meets the challenge at a high level, but not a lot of detail provided.

Potentially, good idea. But that's about it. It doesn't really read like a proposal. Would have loved to learn how this concept ties together with the larger theme and where we can benefit from it. We can assume - education is always needed - but proposal needs to highlight those connections specifically so that we can understand author's narrative and intentions. At the moment - we don't know that much. Needs a bit more work to explore it's potential.
There is not enough information in the proposal regarding the plan and experience in  order to adequately assess it's implementation success probability

The proposer has relevant experience in blockchain technology. It would be great if there is a plan for the project itself. How does the proposer wants to realize the project (Youtube channel, Udemy, website, e-learning, etc.) It's not clear how the proposer going to implement the solution.
The stated expirience should okay for the creation of an introduction to the topics.
There's no clear plan of how to practically deliver Haskell courses to developers

There is no description of a plan. The proposer described experience as software development, but it is not clear what his level of experience with Haskell / blockchain is. I recommend that the proposal present a plan according to the Catalyst guidelines and documentation and that the proposer describes in detail his professional experiences / skills, in addition to adding a link to Github and Linkedin.
No discernible purpose or plan here.
It would indeed be useful to focus on mental models that facilitate building smart contracts, and the tools needed to build them, but this proposal does provide KPIs for success.

Experience and knowledge would appear to be suitable.
Unfortunately due to the lack of detail provided it is too difficult to determine if the proposal will be followed through and completed as intended.

Unfortunately, proposal doesn't offer appropriate depth in detail that could help us determine if A: there is enough valid experience to take this to production B: how/what the budget will be used for exactly. This may be due to the fact that this feels like a concept - more than an idea. There needs to be an actual plan presented as it is currently missing. So it isn't investable.
There is no information in the proposal regarding it's feasibility and how effectively it addresses the challenge.
The proposal lacks of information on the KPI, how does the implementation will affect/address the challenge.
The proposal contains no plan on how the solution will be implemented. Not technical and also not time-wise.

The proposal is not taking into consideration that there's already a series of Haskell coding classes organized by IOHK. In my opinion this is not adding nothing on top of what has been already planned.
There is not enough information to check how the proposal will impact/address the challenge. No metrics have been described to attest to the feasibility of the proposal.
Not enough information provided to measure if it's successful.
The proposal does not provide a justification for its budget, nor does it detail specific deliverables (number, types of contracts, languages, etc.).

Not enough information has been provided.
There is no outline of a general plan unfortunately.

As it reads like a concept - it lacks basic elements such as roadmap, milestones, success metrics, KPIs, challenges/risks considered and other usual suspects. I suggest visiting Catalyst Discord and reaching out for mentors to help you guide how to improve proposal. It has a good idea but just not enough for community to consider it seriously just yet. Please, rework and submit at later stages.
This proposal does meet the challenge criteria to some extent but I found it difficult to fully assess with the limited information provided.
The  proposal does not really address the challenge since it  is a very generic idea with no data to support it's viabilty.

The proposal presented is very simple, just a draft and although it technically allows the use of a dapp, it is not clear what is the appeal for people to use this interface to consult recipes and what is the importance of putting this on the blockchain. Monetization can be a factor, but since monetization has not been described in detail there is no way to evaluate it.

A nice idea and it's in a space (cooking) that does not get a lot of attention. The descriptions are lacking though, and success relies too heavily on marketing to those outside Cardano, which is never addressed.

Peculiar concept - worth exploring but the author doesn't provide enough information to learn about utility and use case more specifically with goals of cardano blockchain. There are some assumptions we can make - tx fees and so on - but would have liked to read a more expanded idea than just few sentences. It isn't an investable project just yet absent of many details in other sections.

Whilst a recipe dapp might be of interest to a few people I don't think that it will encourage a wide audience. 
Paying to add a recipe is a barrier and there are so many free recipes available via current search sites.
Your skills look very useful so I think you just need to find a more suitable project/idea to work on.
Best of luck!
The author does appear to have the skill necessary although it is difficult to give an accurate assessment without further information.
There is not enough information in the proposal regarding the plan and experience in  order to adequately assess it's implementation success probability.

There is no detailed plan to understand the proposal, the need to use the blockchain and how monetization will be, without this information it is not possible to assess the feasibility. The proposer reported experience with developing smart contracts and Haskell, but there is no link to Github or Linkedin to certify and check his skills.
No real practical experience in this space from the team. Has more of a "build it and they will come" attitude. The budget seems VERY low.

No references, links are provided to establish experience at all. Nor do we understand what the purpose of requested budget is for exactly. This ties into the fact there isn't a sensible plan in place just yet. Adding these elements would help elevate the proposal beyond its current concept stage.

The proposers experiences looks very useful to the eco-system, but unfortunately not enough information was provided to determine if the idea could actually work or if there is a market for a decentralised recipe chain where users pay to upload a recipe.

Whilst i do like the concept i would have liked to see more information to help me make an informed assessment. The level of funds requested are not unreasonable but greater detail is required to assess this proposal higher.
There is no information in the proposal regarding it's feasibility and how effectively it addresses the challenge.
There is not enough information to check the feasibility of the proposal and how it will address the challenge.
No information given regarding the core mechanics, aside from uploaders paying a fee.

Because there is so little information provided, we are unable to find any roadmap elements or milestones either. Following, we don't have any metrics present that could help us define these in a greater manner. Not knowing any challenges/risks either are also one of those useful elements missing. I would suggest to work on this idea in greater detail and try to come back in later funds in the funding doesn't happen this time around.

Not enough information provided for this idea. No reason/advantage that this needs to be on the blockchain.
Plenty of competition makes this difficult for people to pay to upload a recipe, and not incentive to encourage uploading of reciptes.
I have no idea why this should be based on a blockchain and how this application would be a good flagship for Cardano.

The proposal presents an idea / draft of a platform for creating resumes, but it is not clear what the purpose of a dapp (instead of an app) and the need to use blockchain on that platform. In order to be able to understand if the proposal addresses the challenge, it is necessary to understand what type of use the platform will have in the blockchain.
I do not think that this proposal effectively addresses any part of the challenge - it seems to be still in the concept stage.
It's a nice idea, to be sure, but has too many variables that are not accounted for to be implemented at this time.

Provide more information to convince the voters that there is an advantage to have this service using blockchain. How can this proposed application handle the different CV requirements needed to be tailored to each of the different job types around the world? Maybe start with a small scope and define it in the proposal.

There is very little depth in terms of how much this idea is worked through. It is a peculiar use case but would have loved to learn/understand more of what authors are planning to do with it in general. There isn't really any attempt presently to tie the proposal into how it all fits within greater goals of Cardano. Knowing that would also help understand impact it could have once launched and benefits drawing out of it for the community. Needs more work to be able to present it as investable proposal.
The idea could be expanded to applying these resumes to potential employers, creating a decentralised interim service.
Within Discord there are questions posed without follow-up and nothing included in this proposal either.
Software engineer is the only provided information. No plan provided.

The presented plan lacks details. There is not enough information to assess the proposer's qualifications. Without this information, it is not possible to assess the chances of successful implementation of the proposal.
The proposer does have an idea for a potential Dapp or integration, but the available in-depth information on experience and the lack of a plan are not confidence inspiring.
No team member with HR experience. No plan in place on how to seed a 2-way marketplace. Budget is too low to be done well.
There is no mention of resources with experience in HR and Recruitment who can provide requirements and advice to make this proposal work.

Given the lack of information provided - we are unable to determine experience levels, readiness with team/individuals to carry out proposal. Nor we have clear understanding what this particular budget/and how/ it plans to achieve what it sets out to do. This also happens because there really is a missing sensible plan that would tie it all together. I would suggest reworking proposal and adding more information so that community can examine it properly.

It leaves me with 2 massive questions: 
1) What would happen if this idea gets widespread and everybody creates resumes in the same format? There would be no way to 'distinguish' oneself. 
2) What about privacy risks? It concludes handing out personal information to strangers over the internet.
No relevant experience listed, only title. No follow up leads to impression that no follow up will happen.
There is not enough information to assess the feasibility of the proposal and how it will address the proposed challenge.
The proposal could benefit from providing much better information on feasibility, a detailed plan, milestones, a budget breakdown. It is not baked well enough.
Not enough information provided. The idea technically addresses the challenge, but is lacking any relevant context as to how it can be successfully implemented

As a suggestion, work with recruitment agencies and get feedback on what requirements the application should meet in order to become useful. With the requirements, lay out a solution which has a chance to attract applicants and reviewers. Provide a strong argument why using blockchain is an ideal solution. Create an initial scope or target market to develop and test out.

Due to being it a really barebone concept - there is lack of roadmap and milestone elements. We don't know how and when this can achieved. Nor is there any understanding appropriate metrics, KPI, challenges, risks. Things that would make it easier for community to understand how auditable this project is. How do we measure its success/progress or lack thereof. Adding these elements will help elevate proposal. But at the moment we can't consider it for funding as is.
The plan seems hastily written down and lacks crucial information: risk assessment, roadmap, funding detail, ROI.
There is no identified value returned to the community, and no indication of what KPI's matter.

The subject of the proposal definitely interesting and fits within the challenge. I would love to see a detailed plan to implement API for loyalty programs. However, in the current form, the proposal is too vague to justify positive evaluation.

In general the proposal is a draft and there are no details, so there is no way to assess whether the proposal will address the challenge. There is no mention of which apps the proposal refers to in the solution description, in addition the problem statement doesn't present a problem.
This proposal seems to be still in the idea stage and as such does not effectively address the challenge.
I am not sure was is proposed. Creating incentive programs and gift-cards or create an api that allows other applications to buy ada for the purpose of the topics I stated before.

The way how this proposal is put together at the moment - it is very challenging to judge its potential impact. We can't really - as there isn't enough information provided at all. Knowing how it would align with greater goals of cardano community would be useful.
Just an idea presented with no details of technology to be used and tasks involved.
The problem statement isn't a problem but a statement. The strategy to bring cardano adoption is not explained by GTM, and the problem is not identified or quantified.

provided information about experience is minimal and there is no plan on how they want to implemnt the proposal.

It is not really stated what they want to do and how they want to do it. Disappointing.

Because this is such modest proposal of few words only - there really is no indication of roadmap, milestones, success metrics, challenges/risks, etc. Would really like to explore more how this proposal could do better next time but it really needs more effort to be put into. I would like to like this but I can't because a) you've merely copy-pasted a proposal you've given to "the Curve Community and team" and b) even if it was customized for Cardano it sounds almost too professional for Project Catalyst and you should discuss it directly with IOG.

The proposal is a ready made governance package for proposal funding that has been deployed on other blockchains. It is not clear if the proposers plan on replacing ideascale or supplementing ideascale. The propoasl would needs funding of around $200k for total project completion over several funding rounds, with a plan to iterate with the community. Gains wouldn't be realized until funding of ~$200k is realized which isn't available in the current fund.

With full deployment, the proposal promises many things that will increase community participation with proposal funding and confidence in the vote by putting it all on the blockchain with reputation linked to addresses.
Proposal wants to add support for Cardano to the existing Commonwealth UI. Main feature would be linking the ADA wallets to the UI and thus facilitating reputation.
Curve.fi could bring solid ideas that are tested with other chains as well. With full implementation They could provide valuable governance.

The proposal doesn't describe how it will address the challenge in a relevant way.

There is no rationale explaining why the CommonWealth woud be an effective decision-making tool. The complexity of Catalyst is many times greater than the governance of projects present on the CommonWealth platform. 

The solutions presented on the CommonWealth platform do not indicate any significant decision making  increase in relation to what we already have today with IdeaScale and which we will have with the voting centers of the Daedalus and Yoroi wallets.

"Developers do not have the funding to complete the network upgrades." This sentence of the problem statement doesn't make sense.
The proposal team is led with agile methodology and has already implemented this system on other blockchains such as Curve.
Proposing team is quite experienced, Commonwealth UI is live and working with other blockchains. Plan is developed and clearly presented.
Nothing about what I have looked though leads me to believe the proposer would fail to meet their plan.

There is no rationale on how this proposal will contribute to the decision-making process.

There is no description of the people involved in the implementation, I recommend that the summary of those involved in the proposal be added, in addition to their professional experiences and qualifications.

The CommonWealth and Macroscape team have worked on projects for the ETH foundation, Edgeware, and Nodle, which shows experience in governance models, but Catalyst's complexity exceeds that of any other blockchain at the moment.
I don't see how something meant for Curve (and bunch of others) would help Project Catalyst.

I do not see clearly how the proposal will significantly promote small pools, the creation of an alternative pool explorer alone doesn't guarantee success, I think it is important that the strategy is more detailed. The proposal description doesn't show how it will address the challenge, as the focus of the proposal is on SPOs and delegators and not on developers. First of all, if you look at the meta-level that the idea of this proposal is aimed at, it is obvious that this approach is an important element in the long-term success of Cardano in particular, and blockchain in general. Sensible regulation and establishing new projects will of course help Cardano to grow. The challenge is about to strengthen Catalyst for the next funding rounds. I am missing the linkage to this setting in the proposal.

The problem he/she wants to solve is a real issue. Regulation is still an uncertainty in our industry. However, this part of the proposal does not directly address the challenge. He/she also wants to initiate projects for Cardano. The described project (Integration, Adaption, Research) could contribute to the community right now and are useful to build upon them in the future.

The proposal is not clear on how it would improve outreach to potential proposers. For the select group of identified potential proposers, there isn't clarity on how the proposal would bring them into ideascale, and the entities are not named but spoken of in broad terms.

The proposal presents information in a "food for thought" format rather than a cohesive description of a solution with a plan. It does not appear to be aligning with the category challenge and does not seek to provide results for the next two funds.

No detailed personal information in the proposal and on the linked website are presented. So, it is hard to judge if the relevant experience is true or not. I understand the budgeting as an initial funding for this long-term approach. So, I think the amount is fair. There are many plans in this proposal, but they sound more like ideas because the proposer missed to proof that his network and experience really exists. Stay anonymous in crowdfunding makes no sense to me. So I suggest for a future proposal, to add verifiable references. Then it would be much easier to judge whether a successful implementation is likely.

An experienced team with great network is mentioned, but there is no link to "real" faces. So, I have to doubt this until there is a proof. He/she has many ideas how to contribute to the Cardano network, but the plan for implementation is too unspecific and for this reason questionable. How the budget will be spent is not described in detail so I can't say if it is appropriate.
The team behind this proposal is not identified, and there is no clear plan on how it would be implemented.

As per the proposal, it appears there is a team of like-minded thinkers with experience in judicial environment. They mention they have already started undertaking certain steps to realize their plan (unclear). They have potential to secure funding with a better written proposal that does a better job communicating their wants and needs to the voters, as well as applying in the right category.

I have read this proposal several times and also the proposers' answers to comments, but I am still struggling to get the point how this approach will contribute the community right now. Yes, I understand, that the proposer has a long-term approach. But how to get started remains somehow abstract. There is a roadmap, but it left me with even more questions. Where does the proposer get the big fashion brand? There is no evidence of a real connection between proposer and a university (maybe there really is, but it is not documented). Lobbying in EU for digital Euro? The ECB is already official working on this (https://www.ecb.europa.eu/euro/digital_euro/html/index.en.html). The proposer stated "concrete steps (…) for introduction to regulators" but missed to say what the concrete steps may are. The goal is to get Cardano on the radar, but how does the proposer measure it? Again, I think the basic idea of this proposal is important, but for me the proposer missed it several times to make it really clear and comprehensible. Therefore, auditability is quite hard for me.

The milestones are mentioned without a time horizon. Only one metric/KPI to measure success (4 AI projects). One last thing: Does the proposer really know much about Cardano? It is likely that he/she does. But especially the comments about integration of existing project of other blockchains to Cardano brought me to this thought. Which one does the proposer really mean, because many/most functions of Cardano are still under development? We all love to see Ethereum tokens converting into Cardano tokens. But if he/she had been more specific on this, it would be way easier to imagine how the community would get it because of his/her commitment. All in all, the proposal should have provided more details for the community regarding plans, risks and experience.
There is no mention of how the proposal can be measured for successful proposer outreach.

The proposal does not provide any detailed information on specific timelines or expense breakdown for funds requested. They do not provide a list of minimum result that is desired to be achieved with the money requested, rather a long term, general goal.
It is an interesting product that is based on a Blockchain. As it is very specialized, I doubt that it will increase the benefit and acceptance of cardano much.

The goal of this challenge is to attract new entrepreneurs to Catalyst. As this teams wants to start a campaign on LinkedIn it addresses the challenge.

The question in the challenge brief is "How can we encourage entrepreneurs from outside the Cardano ecosystem to submit proposals to Catalyst in the next two funds?". I think that the proposed idea to utilize LinkedIN/Social Media to achieve this goal is a good approach. However, there are some problems that I see in the proposal itself, as the proposal does address the challenge - but in my view it doesn't do it effectively enough. Effectively is a key word. What do I mean? I think that the proposal is not focused enough on encouraging entrepreneurs, which is the focus group. The proposer suggests: "Post this Challenge on LinkedIN/Social Media and ask for comments, invite people to ideascale to create profiles and review proposals." Creating profiles and reviewing proposals - is not the immediate goal. Reaching people over social media does not automatically translate into encouraging entrepreneurs, and I see this as a weakness of this specific proposal. It could benefit from much more added detail and a very specific gameplan on how to leverage the advantages of the LinkedIn and other social media platforms to attract companies and entrepreneurs. The proposal is too generic in my view, without a well-thought out plan.

The proposer is aiming to utilize LinkedIn platform and its mechanics in order to inform and attract potential proposers to project Catalyst. This idea effectively addresses the challenge as it will create a long term effect targeting the right audience.
Creating a LinkedIn presence for Project Catalyst could attract attention from entrepreneurs but the challenge that is to be posted to social media is not explained in the proposal.
The proposal addresses the challenge, but the plan is just a draft, there are no concrete details.

The team states that they have relevant marketing experience. However, I can't find evidence on the given links (LinkedIn, company website). Well, you don't really need much experience to start with online marketing. However, experience helps a lot. To reach a large target group organically on LinkedIn, you need a large network, which the team may have (500+ on LinkedIn). On the other hand, paid ads on LinkedIn are very expensive (approx. 10$ per click!). I am missing a detailed plan on how the budget is going to spend. So, I can't judge if it is reasonable. For only organic traffic (incl. content creation) it seems to be too high (as I work in this industry). For a paid campaign there is no specific plan (including KPIs). In the comment section is also something mentioned about brand building. But I don't find it in the proposal itself. In conclusion, I am not sure of the success of this proposal.
The timeline is detailed, realistic and with clearly market dependencies.

As regards the experience and the plan, I think this plan lacks sufficient detail for me to be able to asses it as "highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully". The proposal seems to be still more in an idea stage, while the difficulty in most proposals is the very detail and precise series of steps that will be implemented. The requested funds are USD 25000, however the proposer also specifies in the proposal and the comments that he will "be working with two other proposals to create some branding and marketing collateral, so $1000 to infographics,
https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Infographics-Series-1/340837-48088
and $1000 to swarm sessions
https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Voltaire-Assistant-Swarm-Sessions/340811-48088"
This raises more questions - what happens if these two other proposals also receive funding and why would this proposal be allocating additional funding to two other proposals that are already applying for funding in a separate effort. What if all three proposals are selected by the community for funding, do we have an overfunding situation. These are important issues that involve community funds and need to be thought out well and addressed by the proposer. 
I would have liked to see more information about the proposers experience with Linkedin promotional campaigns, metrics, other proof of the proposers suitability to implement this project. This would not be an absolute must, but in the lack of it - a very detailed plan of steps would have helped. Both are lacking.
The proposer claims to be experienced in marketing and HR, which gives them the right tools in order to undertake this project. One star taken for the lack of proven track record.

The proposer has a LinkedIn page for their company (https://www.linkedin.com/company/quasarrisk/), but it only has once sentence written, and the website link on it (http://www.quasarrisk.com/) is broken. The overall plan seems good, but it needs more evidence to support the proposers' relevant experience.
There is no reasonable plan, the idea is a draft. There are no details about the proposers, their experiences and qualifications.

There are no milestones or an explicit roadmap with a time horizon. No metrics to measure the progress are given. A detailed plan about implementation is also missing. There are only "ideas" and "suggestions". The risks of this proposal (it is so easy to waste money in online marketing) are not considered.
The team listed is consisted of seasoned professionals that are able to deliver the product in a time and cost efficient manner.

I think that this proposal is very promising in its approach and idea, but not in the proposed realization, plan and feasibility. It could be resubmitted with a clearer plan and more details in subsequent funding rounds. The proposal, in my view, does not provide sufficient information to easily assess how feasible it is and how effectively it addresses the challenge, due this lack of detail. The allocated funds are not broken down into components, more milestones would strenghten the chances of this proposal as would some measurable targets and deliverables.

Not enough information is presented on how exactly the plan will be executed and no detail is provided on their mentioned partnership with another proposer in Fund4. The proposal would benefit from detailed breakdown of timeline and budget to achieve results.

The proposal does not have any KPIs or roadmap. It is unclear what challenge will be posted to social media. More information about the plan and experience of proposers is needed to assess the feasibility.

There are not enough details to check the feasibility of the proposal and what impact it will have on the challenge. There are no details explaining the need for a $ 25,000 budget budget without a plan.

The proposal is very aligned to the current challenge, this may make the life of developers much easier in the Cardano ecosystem.

The proposal is as per the challenge as the dapp will increase the adoption of Cardano platform.

The proposal is built with maximum required details.

Javascript is widely used and Haskell is not familiar to much wider developer community thus this is a much needed application.

This proposal is a perfect fit for this challenge as this will open the door to all Javascript developer to easily and directly interact with a Cardano node without the use of external tools.
Javascript being one of the most accessible and used language on Earth, the successful implementation of this proposal would tremendously benefit the dev ecosystem of our community.
Having a Networking library in JS will open up so many application ideas due to the lack of data points in the existing infra.

This is what is needed.
Using JS API calls to Haskell routines makes the eco-system so much easier and more accessible to the millions of JS devs currently out there.
If the JS devs can just pickup-and-go and not have to learn a whole new language then the adoption rate will be much faster. Plus existing ideas/projects needs developers will have a greater pool of devs to choose from.

Something like this will eventually get written, why not these guys? They have shown via Cardanoscan that they are capable and committed.
I fully support this project.

Javascript has a very large cadre of developers that at the moment cannot be utilised within the Haskell community. This answers the challenge because it can on-board more developers that are outside of the Haskell community.

It's quite clear from the proposer, that they have experience and knowledge on finishing this project. The project duration is quite good. And the resources that they need is described well enough in the proposal. Good job!
They have built and do run an explorer from ground up, this experience looks pretty relevant and sufficient for them to pull this off.

Cardanoscan seems to have already started their networking library, albeit limited to the requirements of their system. The proposal presents a good itemisation of what is required to build the complete library with the resources needed specified in both budget and timelines.

Looks like the existing explorer(Cardanoscan) using this JS networking package is doing pretty much very well already. Looks like they have good relevant experience in building the networking package for cardano.

There is experience is quite good with what is being built. There is experience of building application on Cardano platform. Details of the technology used is well-demonstrated. With experience, skills and details provided there is lot of confidence that this proposal will be implemented successfully.

There is need to strongly motivate such initiatives

The team has already built a successful Cardano explorer platform (cardanoscan.io) which is already using an early version of what they want to continue building with this proposal.
The budget can seem high with almost 25% of the challenge funds but the time frame and use of funds are realistic for such a project.
The proposer has confirmed that cardanoscan.io will itself use the library which ensures that it will be maintained as the Cardano platform continues to evolve in the years to come.
As the proposal mentions about the team members behind Cardanoscan will work on the new library, It's very likely it be implemented.

Based on work done so far with Cardanoscan we can assume that this team is already very knowledgeable with inner workings of Cardano processes.

They mention that the same team will from Cardanoscan  will be working on this project, so completing the project should be low risk.
I believe that the team has the relevant experience and a proven track record. The plan seems sound and deliverable.

Yes, from the proposal itself, the deliverables are clear. And it's very feasible to create NPM library for Ouroboros Networking Library in JavaScript. I hope that this proposal will continue to the next round.
The proposal mentions about how they are going to address the problem/challenge in detail, providing specific details around the implementation, usecase and execution of plan.

I believe the experience of building Cardanoscan has equipped this proposal with first-hand information on what is required to build a complete JS library. Each of the deliverables are identified including the challenge of every step. Abiding by IOHK standards & protocols, as mentioned, provides confidence that the solution will be beneficial to the overall development of Cardano particularly from developers not familiar with Haskell..

The proposal has the technicalities mentioned in detail and how it will be implemented. This will help JS developers hop-on quickly and start developing things up on the Cardano blockchain. High likely this will help onboard many devs.

The proposal document provides enough confidence that the solution will seriously worked upon and get to the mark successfully. 

There is good research and handson experience that showcases the required skills.

There is sufficient information and details to consider the feasibility of the solution.

The goals are well defined and achievable, there is nothing technically preventing this implementation to happen since the protocol exists in a different language it's "just" a reimplementation in Javascript. Only time and experience is needed to make this project happen. The time budgeted and the approach both seem correct and realistic.
My only regret is the lack of information about the developers who will do the job: what is their experience in functional style programming? Having transitioned myself from imperative to functional style programming I know for a fact that this is not easy at all...
Totally agree with the proposal in building a JS library to allow developers to build new tools on top of it.

Enough detail was provided to determine that the tools to be developed would meet the needs of developers. I know that I would use these tools rather than learn Haskell.
If they develop what they mentioned then that is a big step in the right direction to suddenly have a huge pool of developers to engage in new Cardano projects, right when we really need them.

Ongoing maintenance would be a point to consider. Typically these sort of projects are never really 'done'. There are always better/quicker ways for processes to operate.
Would our community be ok to keep this project alive over enough time to make a full featured library set? Just a thought.
Good plan, lots of information, lots of feedback/communication with the community shown; I think this is deliverable and could help address the challenge.
Sure, to build a Smart Contract in Cardano network, you need Haskell developer. And I agree to finish Liqwid project, what the proposer needs at the moment is more knowledgeable DEVS.
